The modding community is great- there's TDM Cars for the car enthusiasts, WAC Aircraft and their community packs for them hardcore pilots and 9K Murderthon gun packs for the murderous soldiers. There's like a quadzilion of different mods available to you in Garry's Mod- with a fair ammount of them on the Workshop. There are different maps, game modes (such as the well-known TTT) and just a fantastic community. The best part about it? Multiplayer. You can build, fight etc. etc. with your friend or friends! Or some people from the other side of the world! This is a total must get, especially with the winter sale coming up.

review: I've played upwards of 20 hours which isn't all that much for me but that was BEFORE i figured out how to dupe things and download addons. And this is just the most damn fun i've had in forever. Sandbox is fun, alone or with people, the amount of messing around you can do is endless But then there are game modes.. you can do anything from survive zombie attacks to play hide and seek, to doing parkour, to playing football. Whatever takes your fancy. You can also build practically any kind of vehicle or make any object into one, and if you're lazy you can just dupe things in other people have made. It's not limited to objects, though. You can get rollercoasters and even entire maps. And a Dear Sister Gun complete with music. Oh and you can set off fireworks And be a firework And hell you can make the house from Up with balloons.. And a whole plethora of other nonsense and just pure fun. This however is only fun if you're willing to explore the spawn menu. If you just walk around being confused like i was to begin with you won't find a reason to keep playing. Amazing game! Well worth the pennies it costs for a lifetime of entertainment!

game-hours: 309.1
review: Garry's Mod- I'll try to look at it unbiased. I personally, LOVE this game, and it has something for everyone, whether that is a crime-solving mystery game, surfing, hiding as a prop while big men with guns try to find you, building sleds, or my favorite, building explosive rocket cars and seeing how far they go before they inevitably break. Many, MANY youtubers have brought more attention to the game, such as the Yogscast, CaptainSparklez, SeaNanners, and even PewDiePie. There is not, and never will, be an aim to the game. The big youtubers play gamemodes such as Prop Hunt, Trouble in Terrorist Town, and Murder, mainly because building isn't an interesting target for viewers. The original goal was to build whatever you wanted, and nothing else. It is very rare nowadays that people just build... But that is not neccesairily a bad thing. Now, onto my personal thoughts: The game is original, fun, centered around creativity, encourages modification, and, well, does whatever it wants. It reminds me of games like roblox- A base for creating what you want, a gaming platform. TL;DR: This game is amazing. Buy it.

review: This is one of the best games on all of steam. It might not have the best graphics or gameplay, but the things you can do with the steam workshop are mind blowing. The community is really friendly, so you'll be able to find a friend to play with easyly. You need to get this, you will have hours of fun. Also, I'd recomend getting CS:S with it. review: Instead of a full review (which you can find plenty of in this section), I will shorten it down to a positive/negative table. (That's right, just for you, lazy boy!) + Great sandbox game for players and modders. + Many different online game modes. + Many different offline game modes. (Go ahead and take a look around!) + Plenty of workshop items. + Great communities. - Outdated on many ends. - Bugs everywhere. Not well coded either. - Some game modes are simply copied from CSS community servers. (What means, you can experience those gamemodes in CSS too, you don't need Gmod for that.) - Many imature children running around. If you find a good community, you should be safe though. If you are still not sure, if you should buy it and try it out: Go for it! You are missing out on something that is not comparable to any other gaming experience (yet)!

game-hours: 876.0
review: Garry's Mod is one of those games that if you don't buy it, you are putting yourself to shame. Get off of your computer chair and buy this game NOW. With a variety of game modes from Sandbox and DarkRP to Murder and Trouble In Terrorist Town, new game modes and new servers are coming out EVERY DAY. This is a game that I have sadly not had enough time to play but I think that your 5 (I think) that you will spend to get this game will give you unlimited content (unless you get banned from all of the world's servers). There is always another server to join and new adventures to participate in. If you're the type that gets bored easily, you'll still get at LEAST 300 hours out of this game. If you aren't, get ready for the adventure of your lifetime and make sure you have a comfortable computer chair because you could spend up to 3000 hours on this game and possibly more. There are quite a few people who have spent the equivalent of a YEAR playing this game and it will run on ANYTHING. It even runs on my 5 year old APPLE MAC which is literally the most basic computer possible. It is impossible to not like this game. You can even rent a server from various suppliers if you're up for the challenge. One thing I will say though, is to watch out for the Badmins. Badmins are Admins who use their powers to degrade other people's experiences, but it's not really something that takes away from the game. My final verdict for Garry's Mod is an enthusiastic 9/10! It only JUST misses the 10/10 mark for the Badmins, occasional false VAC Bans and the fact that I wasted an hour of my life on a terrible server that kept messing me around before finally putting me out of my misery and banning me. Everything else, however, is pure gold and this game competes with the greats like Grand Theft Auto V in my view. Cancel any plans you have tonight - you will be super-glued to your computer chair. If you like this game, also consider trying out Facepunch Studio's other major title, Rust, a zombie-survival game where everybody starts without any clothes on. Literally. Anyway, I hope this review helped you out, and enjoy spending a small amount of cash on this legendary. Thanks for reading. Peace.

game-hours: 806.8
review: best game ever
game-hours: 44.1
review: Anybody who is any sort of fan of Valve games must stick this one on their wishlist and grab it when they've got the dough to cherish this game. Garry's Mod, albeit just a utilisation of the standard game engine, playing online on this game shows off how far the community have taken this. The game engine has been well and truly taken advantage of in a way that has flourished the creativity of gamers everywhere, yielding only a immersive and captivating online experience in modes such as Prop Hunt, Murder and Trouble in Terrorist Town. These game modes take place on well-known Counter Strike: Source maps and give Garry's Mod a familiar feel while uping the social advantages of having such an abudance of creative game modes. Buying this game will ultimately provide you with enjoyment, and it's one of those games that everybody eventually needs to have. It's smooth and fun, fast-paced and exciting. A great advantage is that you can play it endlessly because there's so many different gametypes that everytime you get bored of one, there's always somewhere else you can go where you feel like you're playing a whole new game altogether. So, why exactly should you buy it? Prop Hunt (a Garry's Mod gametype) captures my attention the most; a hub for laughs as players disguise as objects to hide from 'hunters', the team that must eliminate the team disguising as props. It's like the game of hide-and-seek you always wish you had played as a child. It's tremendous. 'Trouble in Terrorist Town' (or 'TTT') is yet another gametype that can be pretty amusing. Basically, you can be innocent or you can be a traitor. The game assigns each person with one of those titles and then from there, nobody knows who is who. However, for the traitors, they see who else is a traitor and who isn't. Unsurprisingly, their job is to kill (without being caught), and it's fun trying to find out who the traitors are! 'Murder' is similar to TTT in a way that everybody appears the same. There's only one murderer, though, but nobody knows who it is, and only a select couple of bystanders (people who aren't the murderer) get a weapon. It's perhaps the most realistic simulation of being in a mental institution I have ever seen. That's just a taste of Garry's Mod; due to its lively community, the creativity of what people can do with the Valve game engine is simply constant, and there's always something new to try.
game-hours: 216.4
review: This game is the best sandbox game out there for more than half the time i had missing textures but it was still great. i HIGHLY recomend this game 10/10
game-hours: 15.8
review: AWESOME GAME
game-hours: 1712.3
review: If you don't have this game you have not played a true sandbox PC game. I would either buy this game 10 more times or have it priced for $70. Amazingly addictive and a fun use of time 10/10
game-hours: 373.8
review: Garry's Mod. The very name conjures up images of ragdolled bodies flying through the air as a C4 has exploded in TTT, of countless props spawned whilst trying to make something that, when you take a step back, only slightly resembles the Death Star. For all it's flaws, of which there are few, it makes up in its charm, endless amount of mods, gamestyles and general sillyness. Its issues surrounding hit-boxes are annoying, often find yourself shooting somebody in the face with a shotgun only to discover you've missed and subsequently blown your cover as a Traitor in TTT but you quickly adapt and stab him before he can yell out your name in a pitch that resembles a pre-pubescent little boy. The ladders suck of course but if you're careful enough you'll probably land safetly and if not, after about 5 minutes of rage at being eaten alive in ZombieMod because your character can't quite grasp the function of ladders, you laugh it off and persue the other survivors. I've had some of the best hours of my life playing TTT and Garry's Mod in general, if you're on the fence about it, you shouldn't be, for about 10 (That and CS:S) its a bundle of joy that will keep you up at night until ungodly hours.

I don't see myself leaving this game any time soon unless I have to go to classes at college but besides that this game is far worth the experience and laughs along the way.

game-hours: 249.1
review: Garry's Mod. You'll most likely do absolutley nothing productive in your first hour of playing. You'll look at the NPCs. Maybe face pose some ragdolls into genius works of art or hideous abominations. You'll look at the weapons. Get a mod or two. All that kind of stuff- but then, your flat world of near-pointlessness will expand. You'll make movies that desrve -2 oscars, but are still amazing. You can make a minigame using a save that will rocket you to the top of the most popular saves list for about 3-5 days. You'll make vehicles out of everything, and only spam thrusters when your friends are in a vehicle. You can go on a server and play with the community. You can even make an addon for the community. So, why wait to buy this, when you can get it now and do all of the things I just said. Why? Because in Garry's Mod, you can do anything- and yes, that includes making a pigeon-powered bathtub tank if you have the right mods.

game-hours: 102.8
review: Dis Game is FUN.... ololo
game-hours: 258.3
review: A hilarious game mode that attracted me in as soon as i started playing it. I was first attracted to Garry's Mod from Youtube, mostly from Trouble in Terrorist Town, but my interest was piqued by many more game modes when I opened the servers list. Dark RP is an amazing roleplaying gamemode which has you pick a job and live among others. The people can sometimes troll, but whenever that happens, just have a laugh yourself. TTT, on the other hand, brings you into a scenario of 3 people, the Traitor, Innocent, and Detective. The Traitor is amazing (my favorite) to play, strategizing the best way to kill everyone on the map with your fellow comrade(s). Another gamemode (or multiple gamemodes should i say) that I loved was Gmod Tower. It was almost a hotel, where you could get a room and decorate it using furniture. Where did you get this furniture? From games or course! You were able to match up against players in different gamemodes, and reap your rewards to decorate yourself, your room, and even give you an edge up in some games. All in all, Garry's Mod is an amazing game which I would reccomend to anyone looking for a good waste of time that isn't strict at all.

game-hours: 57.2
review: Cool game
game-hours: 696.0
review: Garrys Mod was originally a mod for Half Life 2. It is a sandbox game which revolves around spawning props, experimenting with addons and new content, and multiplayer gamemodes. It is LOADS of fun to play. There is always new content with the steam workshop which includes maps, gamemodes, weapons, models, etc. (Some of the maps make you lag, but don't play on those. Play on decent maps) The multiplayer is fun as well. Here is pros and cons: PROS: Very fun to play, and addons support. - As far as I know, its the only game where you can attach melons and bathtubs to a car using an electronic beam. - Lots of gamemodes besides sandbox. These include Trouble in Terrorist Town, Prop Hunt, and Cinema. CONS: - Multiplayer servers take a long time to connect to. - Some servers lag even if you have a low ping. - Sometimes servers are polluted with people who spam props, objects, etc. Overall, it is well worth the 10 dollars. Buy it.

review: In my time playing this game, I have made countless friendships with a variety of individuals, including several hundred ten year-olds and a pedophile. I am very grateful to have had this great oppurtunity to play one of the most riveting games of all time; I will never forget the great times I had while playing this game, and will likely tell stories about it to my grandchildren, so that they, too, may enjoy this wondrous entertainment. My only regret is that I will never play or see anything as great as this game in my entire life again. Garry's Mod is truly the highpoint of all of our lives, even those who have never played the game. This game changed my life completely, whether that is for better of for worse is uncertain, but I emerge from this game a new person. Anyone looking seeking meaning in their life will enjoy this game immensely.

review: Garry's Mod is a fantastic game, and in my experience (albiet a short one compared to most other people that have it) has been a fantastic one. If you can think it, you can do, build, create it. Garry's mod is one of the few games that is only limited by your own imagination, and that's why I love it. In fact calling it a game is an understatement, it's a whole world of it's own, It's what you make of it. I have experienced very few errors in the game, and the ones that I have experienced were so minute that it hardly affected the gameplay in any way. It is a truly remarkable title and I highly recommend it to anyone and everyone.

game-hours: 22.0
review: I bought this game for $2.50 when it was on sale (I'm a bit of a liberal spender...), and it's been great! The game is mostly community content and borrowed items from other games, which is cool for a good while. But that's just if you're using single player sandbox... When you start playing on servers, the amazing amount of official server mods, such as Melon Bomber, JailBreak, TTT, FireArt, it's even better. It's a good game. A lot of the community content and servers require you to own games, mostly Counter-Strike: Source (hence the gamepack on sale here.), but if you look around the internet, you can get the gamefiles easily without having to buy the game. Note: You don't get the game for having the gamefiles, just the Gmod content.

game-hours: 134.2
review: I'm mostly into the creative side of Gmod but that's not the only thing you can do in Gmod where with Sandbox you can make funny poses, faces or even messing around with the fingers, You spawn enemies, allies to cause a war for your own kinds of fun. But what can you do with the resources at your disposal? Don't have anything that you need? That's where the Steam Workshop part comes in! However You may need to download certain games in the Steam Library to get some things working. Most notable Counter Strike and all of the Half Life Games to avoid Texture errors. [that's how it went for me] However there are good gametypes you can try out though some have their downsides. But here's what I know to those who seek to buy the game. Trouble in Terrorist Town: A fun game of sorts where there are three types of teams. The harmless and yet still carry guns innocents, The detective who is after the main badguy that is known as the traitor: There are ways to tell if one is a traitor or not depending on what kind of weapon does he have that most others can not have? Stop it Slender!: The only Slenderman gametype where one person plays as the Slenderman! And you got to collect all the pages before someone catches you. Have fun while you not being alone! Murder: It's like Trouble in Terrorist town cept a bit more realistic. However the Revolver only has one bullet and the guy who has to kill the Murder is the only one who has it. The murderer himself has a knife to stab with instant kill. Prop Hunt: Hilarious form of Hide and Seek. Rather than tagging someone. You turn into any kinds of objects. Like a Sofa, or a bananna or even a chair. And you hide from other players with rifles and shotguns that is trying to hunt you down and reduce you to shreds. Have fun with that. I'd give this a 9/10 because it's one of the games that would take a while to get used to on the creative side and on the fun side. There are things to be downloaded automatically as you enter the server so you can play the game without any missing models whatsoever.

game-hours: 191.9
review: This is an incredibly versatile game. With lots of gamemodes! Are you creative? Want to build? Play Sandbox. Want to roleplay? Play DarkRP. Want to be a detective, and find murderers? Play Trouble in Terrorist Town. Want to watch YouTube videos with friends? Play Cinema. Want to go on a strange adventure in an elevator? Play Elevator: Source. Want to play Hide and Seek while disguised as a prop? Play Prophunt. Want to play a "Wipeout"-esque type of thing? Try Deathrun. That's only a few gamemodes - there are 1000s. Seriously, there is nothing Garry's Mod can't do. Except make me a sandwich. But you can spawn one in. Plus, you can download weapons, vehicles, props, maps, and things other people have made. You can even play with friends and make some crazy contraptions! If you have other Valve made games such as Half Life 2 (and the episodes), Team Fortress 2, Portal (1 and 2), CS:S, CS:GO, DoD:S you can import stuff like items and maps in to Garry's Mod! It does this for you. 10/10. I can't recommend this game enough.

review: A game that started out as a mod for sandbox in the source engine, using assets from Valves evolved into a full on game that can use the assets of Valves games, but do more with it than mess around and build stuff. There are so many different game modes in this, so many things to do it's incredible. The only problem? The community is full of young kids who saw their favorite youtube playing a game mode and now most of the game is infested with young kids who can ruin the experience, but I've met some pretty cool kids. Overall, it's a very good game for the sheer ammount of content in it thanks to the community.

game-hours: 474.5
review: This is a great game for (almost) all ages! It is very fun and gives you the freedom to do whatever you want. It is mostly a building game, but anything can happen! There are roleplay maps, zombie survival maps, flood survival maps, and a whole lot more available to download on the Internet. The building in this game can get very complicated, but there are tutorials all over the Internet. The game does have violence present in certain multiplayer game modes, and there are guns and zombies available in the spawnlists, but it is definitely not forcing violent content on you. Getting involved in violence in this game is totally optional. Multiplayer with voice chat is available, and the people on there can be profane and rude. However there is no need to play multiplayer when there are thousands of different singleplayer maps to build on and explore! I'd say this game would be best suited for kids 6 and up, assuming that they do NOT engage in multiplayer or violence.

review: Ah yes. Garry's Mod. Among the vast genre of games that Steam has to offer, this has to be by far one of the most entertaining games of the 21st Century! Vertually anything is possible! If you find yourself bored of a certain game mode, don't you worry! Just go to the server selection menu, and pick from the wide variety of servers available at your finger tips. And did i mention, everyone has access to a free baby in the prop selection screen in-game!? This game is well worth the money, and don't forget to go buy Counter Strike: Source. Because without it, your Garry's Mod textures wont work on almost any server! Have fun, friends! - Nico

game-hours: 4523.3
review: this game ruined my life. 10/10
game-hours: 1356.5
review: Best game ever created defenitly a need for a game player
game-hours: 819.7
review: Garry's Mod. Truly the wild card of the Source Engine. So much can be done with this game, it almost baffles my mind! Quite honestly I am surprised nearly every day with the mods I find. One day I find a mod that adds realistic guns, another a mod that adds a new gamemode where I can RP as a character in the HL2 universe. It is my most often played game on steam, and for good reason. The creator of the game is one of the funniest people I have ever heard about. Here is one example! Early on in Gmod's history, there were a bunch of people trying to play cracked versions of the game. So he implimented a file that targeted only the cracked versions of the game, and asked on a public forum if any one was having the issue. The next thing everyone knew, all the cracked Garry's Mod users were getting banned. Now isn't that just genius? It's like some Death Note genius right there. The three most popular gamemodes of which I will go into detail, all have thousands of players on hundreds of different servers. Each of these select gamemodes are widely different and are really entertaining and have many fun experiences for each, so give all the gamemodes a try! Sure, some of them are bound to be stinkers, but most of them are creative and unique. Sandbox: The default gamemode, this is what Garry's Mod was designed around. It is prety self-explanitory, you build with props from various Source games, spawn in enemies from HL2, and weapons to take down those enemies. Oh, and there are mods that add pretty much anything you can think of. I like to add a ton of mods, then go on a Combine massacre. Pretty fun. Trouble in Terrorist Town (TTT): My favorite gamemode, personally. It is a gamemode about stealthily killing innocent terrorists as Traitors. But the detective throws a loop in your plans, or helps you out by using tools to find out who the traitors are. I have played at least 400 hours of this. DarkRP: Basically real-life roleplay. Fun, but there are a lot of rule breakers and squeakers. The vanilla gamemode already has a lot of jobs, but most servers have more than 30 jobs, examples include: Citizen, Police Officer, Gangster, Mob Boss, Mayor, and many more. Overall Rating: 9/10

review: Garry's Mod is something made by gods above the earth working with Valve. It is rediculously fun, neverending, and hell, you might learn something about physics or teamwork because of it. The game is originally a sandbox type of deal but now with a community that breaths without air, you can have races, gunfights, competitive play, and so much more. If I had a list of games every Steam account should own simply because everybody loves it to death, this would go on the list so hard, right next to Half-Life 2. THAT is how good Garry's Mod is. I could tell you even more if you'd like, like for instance, my steam life dealio began because of a lucky choice on Garry's Mod, Garry's Mod builds friends and begins lives.  society, play some Garry's Mod. I'm done here, buy it when you can.

game-hours: 1650.0
review: Garrys mod is the ultimate sandbox game. It plays with physics, mainly in the ways of props, NPCs and models. It uses the parts, models and sounds of any source based game (Mainly Half Life 2 and Counter Strike Source). I have fallen in love with this game, It's use of the source Engine's mechanics is second to none. There are addons for it, these add things like maps, weapons, gamemodes, vehicles and much more. Its multiplayer, like the majoity of all souce engine games, making it great for groups to play together. Things like "Trouble in Terrorist Town' (Formally known as TTT) are game modes. TTT is a great gamemode, made off the fundamentals of betrayal. Garry's mod is an incedible game overall, I highly recommend it. So come on, grab some mates and have a good time. -Sc00p 10/10

game-hours: 463.9
review: This is my number one favourite game OF ALL TIME! (Warning: May cause erection without warning). -================================================================- For anyone who doesn't know what Garry's Mod is: a) You can do pretty much anything. Yep, anything. Create an entire civilization of flying bacon-flavoured waffles only to have them destroyed by a giant-mutant-cyborg toaster from outer space if you want; I don't care. Oh yeah, and it's multiplayer. b) If you don't want to make things or just mess around like that (if so, what is wrong with you?), then you can play more serious or just generally less-creative game modes like 'Trouble in Terrorist Town', 'Zombie Survival' or 'Prop Hunt' (among hundreds of other modes). c) The fun never ends; The Gmod community is one of the largest and most-active gaming communities out there! New mods, models, maps and gamemodes are constantly coming out, plus there's also the hundreds of thousands of things that have already been made. Essentialy, you're always playing Garry's Mod, but you're also playing over a hundred games inside of it. d) If you haven't heard of Garry's Mod, then where have you been hiding? You'd need to completely cut yourself off from the outside world to not have heard of it. You should be ashamed of yourself. So all-in-all, you're paying a small fee to provide yourself with (at minimum) hundreds of hours of awesomely spazztastic fun. At this price, you should feel guilty. Especially with all of the new FREE STUFF that comes out. I would gladly pay 80 or 100 to have this game. Honestly. Not kidding. For real. If you (for some reason) can only have one game ever, then make sure it's this game. I've seen people put in almost 2,000 hours for this game. NOW FOR THE FINAL SCORE -=======================- I have never given a game 100% because surely that's not possible. There's never been a perfect game. Yeah well if you thought that too, you're wrong. Gmod ISN'T a game. It's like thousands of tiny-and-equally-awesome games all in one. 10/10 without any doubt whatsoever. If you disagree, would you kindly go kill yourself please? Thank you.

game-hours: 95.6
review: Garry's Mod is hours of entertainment and a game that I highly recommend. It's on sale on Steam often enough, so if you don't have it, buy it. It's a sandbox-style game that can load content from a number of Source games (TF2, HL2 etc.), as well as having a great selection of weapons, tools, maps and saves available in the steam workshop. You can plonk stuff anywhere you like, build contraptions such as hover cars or even spawn huge weights to crush Barney under (because he still hasn't bought you that beer!) The part I find most enjoyable, though, is loading up the original Half Life 2 maps and using the GMod tools to cause havoc. Bar up doorways, set up trip-wire bombs or even find where Dr. Breen is hiding and replace him with a beach ball. And if you're the programming sort, get WireMod. You can put down a range of sensors and displays to make cool stuff like control panels where you have to turn the key and input a 4 digit code in order to set off the explosion. Takes a bit to learn, but is so much fun!

game-hours: 4341.7
review: This is, in my opinion, the best game ever made. Not because it has a great story, or because of Super Ultra Turbo High-Def 4D Graphics With Blast Processing. It's not good because it has immersive, HUD-less gameply. Not because the controls are great (in fact, sometimes they kind of suck. But at least you can change them.) This game does not have some innovative, never-before-seen combat system. It does not have memorable characters. So what does it have? EVERYTHING. Build. Destroy. Explore. Kill each other. Roleplay. Play with dolls. Drive cars. Program robots and computers. Go platforming. Play golf. Build a fort. It doesn't matter, because you can LITERALLY do anything in this game. This isn't like GTA, where they just SAY you can do anything. In GTA, can you fill a room with toilets and giant-headed aliens? Can you kill Alyx Vance over and over again? Can you live out your fantasies of being Mario or Samus or Link or Master Chief or Sonic or Ryu or the Heavy? You can here.

review: Garry's mod is a stand alone sandbox game originally a hl2 mod These are the pros and cons : -A full game -Ability to port most Source engine game stuff into the Game (hl2, ep1 and 2, CS:S, CS:GO, l4d1 and l4d2) -Ability to choose any gamemode -Ability to choose any map -Ability to download any addon -Ability to build anything -Ability to publish your work to world (Save and Dupe) -Ability to use any tools (lamps,balloons,dupe er,axis,motor,wheel) -Ability to join any server -Ability to create any server -Ability to browse workshop Cons : -Unhelpful players in server (trollers) -Haters -Addon and files may get corrupted by other thing (hard to be fixed, i know) -Takes long time waiting for workshop addon to mount after starting up -Other than English server, LOTS OF server at the top of my server list are from Korean and other languages I don't even know -Nothing to do when nothing is downloaded Suggestions : -Supports new mod the Lambda Wars -Ability to makes fire last at a fixed time -More tools Overall : It's good, it may need some updates and fixes. 10/10

review: Garry's Mod, a game where you can let your imagination run free, and acquire many, many add-ons to make your time there all the more enjoyable. There is seemingly a gamemode for everybody to enjoy, (The gamemodes I usually play are Sandbox, DarkRP, Prop Hunt and TTT) and plenty of servers to keep playing that might have their own custom group of add-ons, allowing you to experiment with new items, that might have you say "Hey, that would be AWESOME to have in my singleplayer!" and then you try it out, and combine it with your other items to have one big collection of some of your favourite game characters, anime characters, weapons, vehicles, NPC's and tons of other cool stuff. In conclusion, all this workshop content that I have been going on about, is what keeps Garry's Mod fresh, new, and one of my favourite games, that I strongly recommend and hope that you give it a try.

game-hours: 349.2
review: 8.9/10 Such an open door for developers of all kinds. The amount of things you can do in Garry's mod, is far too big to post in a review. You can build rockets, stab bystanders, build sleds, or play 'Flappy Garry'. While playing Garry's mod is not competitive, or something to master. You can breath lightly while playing it, and not take it too seriously. When you first open Garry's mod, you will play sandbox, using aspects from other games you can build amazing, or laughable things. The amount of scenarios you can create in sandbox alone, is breathtaking. Yet you have still to discover, many intresting and vastly different gamemodes to enjoy: Trouble in terrorist town, in which you discover the Tratiors, who are killing innocent terrorists in order to win rounds. Roleplay, build houses and and buy cars with the money you get from the money printers you hid from the police. Murder, go around with your knife murdering innocent bystanders, trying to hide your identity. And many, many more... While Garry's mod cannot be called a great game in it's own right. The way it uses aspects from others, and allows you to manipulate and use them, is entertaining. Garry's mod is a game you play on all day, not realising the time. I've racked up not too far short of 200 hours in a couple months, without feeling bored or tired of it at any point.

game-hours: 532.1
review: "This game is a rainbow of possibilities without limits that will make anyone laugh" Garry's Mod is one of the best humoristic games I've ever played. It consists of a large diversity of different gamemodes which offer many possibilities of adjusting the game to your liking completely. The usage of the Half Life engine is really put to good use in Sandbox but also so many other modes. Because of the community the game remains interesting because of the additions they bring. My favorite gamemodes are TTT, Prop Hunt and Sandbox for sure. But other gamemodes will certainly entertain you, and new gamemodes keep popping up aswell. The downside of the game however is that there is a lot of downloading, you require Counter Strike Source to actually play without having failing textures and errors unless you download it from the internet. Sometimes maps or gamemodes require games that the common person does not own. My final conclusion would be that the game is worth the price, you get a lot of content from that small fee. But remember that if you do not have CSS you will have to go through some copying and pasting. I'm rating this game a well deserved 8.5/10, it uses a lot of other games, so rating it higher would not justify it.

game-hours: 332.5
review: This game is epic. Whether you have a vast, creative mind, hungry for building, or a love for shooting things big and small, Garry's Mod is the game for you. With tons of stuff to download from the Workshop, and tons of user-made things in the In-Game interface, you can never run out of stuff to do. You want to fight Alduin with a bazooka? Create a horde of Scouts dangling from a flying saucer? Host a party of Strawberryfish while jamming to a Portal Core that plays music? Ride a raptor into the sunset? Fly a delorean from Back to the Future off a cliff? Have a tea party with Headcrabs? Go for it! Garry's Mod comes with Half Life 2, Source, so you get all the props and weapons to use at your will. It also provides you with the NPC's and vehicles too! You get tons of content for it's astoundingly cheap price, and trust me, it's worth it! Have TF2? You get all the props, maps, backdrops and items! As well as ragdolls for each character! Have Counter Strike Source? You get all the props, maps, backdrops, weapons and items, as well as additional ragdolls! You tempted to buy it yet? Well hold on a minute! You only know the basic parts of Garry's Mod! It features tools such as the Axis tool, Weld, Duplicate, Rope, Winch, Color, Lamp and Bone Poser tools, allowing you to make different structures and creations. In fact, the first thing I did when I got Garry's Mod is build a house out of boxes, and then destroyed it with Alyx's decapitated body! Cool, huh? WELL THATS NOT ALL! You can summon different creatures to fight against, or get SpaceTech's Pet Mod and call zombies to your side! If you like downloading different NPC's and animals, check out PirateCat's stuff! I really recommend the raptors! "Wait!" You say, "This is cool and all, but, what if I just want to drive around in a cool car with my friends?" Hahaha! Well, dear reader, that is possible! TDM Cars, SGM Cars, SligWolf's Vehicles and SCars are a few of the best packs out there that give you amazing vehicles from the sportiest sports car to a fifty foot crane with additional forklifts. Also try out the WAC aircraft pack if you like helicopters and planes. Playing with your friends? No problem. When you go to make a world, you can toggle how many players you want to allow on a server, as well as how many things can be on it [to reduce lag]. Setting it to a local server will stop people further away from joining your server, so you and your friends can play in peace. It is highly recommended that you and your friends have the same addons, because if someone places something that you haven't downloaded, you get a flashing error sign. Unless you like that kind of thing. Garry's Mod features the famous minigames, Prop Hunt, Murder Mystery, Trouble in Terroist Town, Chimera Hunt and Cinema. There are alot more out there like Elevator and GMod Tower, so feel free to download what you want. *Eerie Silence* Well, that about covers it. Now, if you don't mind, I'm going to have a disco party with Wheatley, Lugia, and the JetSet Radio crew, Ta ta for now.

In this the more games you own the better or you can just grab some mods and fool around with your friends. This was money WELL spent and I recommend everyone with $10 in their account to buy this amazing jewel.

review: This is just one of those games you can play for hours on end and won't get bored. There are soo many gametypes for this game for example some of the most popular at the moment are: Murder, Trouble in terrorist town, Jailbreak, Gmod tower, Sandbox, HL2 and DarkRP and many more - And there are always new gametypes being added. If you buy this game I highly recommend buying and installing counterstrike source aswell because the majority of gametypes use the skins, guns and objects from source (do this to avoid annoying error signs). You can also have alot of fun offline aswell, you can almost build anything in this game, from a speedy car to rocket ship. The steam workshop support aswell is amazing for this game, it is a breeze to download things from workshop, for example you can download cars, tools, maps and even a fully functioning dinosaur as I once did. I recommend this game to anyone looking to have good fun!

review: Garry's mod is one of the best sandbox/community driven games on PC and possible in Gaming. If you are going to buy this, you should buy CS:S with it since many game modes use those textures in it. Sandbox mode is nice, you can do many things in that but many people also love to play on game modes, I would recommend TTT as a nice game mode if you find a good server but the sky is the limit in Gmod gamemodes(actaully it is the engine but eh). There are so many things to be said about this game and this review would go on for pages if you were to explain every single custom gamemode that is on garry's mod and you will get you 10/5/2.5 euro or whatever the price is out of it since there is constantly new content developed on servers. A great game with a good community if you know where to look.

game-hours: 3137.4
review: As you can see, I've been playing this game for a very long time. This game is one of the best games I've played, and easily goes on my top 3 list. At first, it was hard to get into. A lot of stuff to learn, experience, and do. You decide if that is a positive note or not. Even after 2+ years, I still find myself getting on once in a while, craving that creative side of me that makes me want to build things. This game is not just one thing. This game is many games in one. There are at least 100+ different gamemodes I've played. Most of them are really good. But if you do get this, try not to get sucked into Gmod Tower. It's really addictive. So yes. I really would reccomend you get this game if you're a creative individual looking to do what you want, when you want, without boundaries or limits. The only limit is your imagination.

review: Garrys mod... There is no begining, no story, no ending. However, Garry's mod gives you a Physics gun, a tool gun, HL2 weapons, some props and a Map to have fun in. Have you ever had a dream of attaching a rocket to a bath and putting a seat in the bath and crashing into everything as you kill everything including yourself? This game can do that. As you create a car, plane, The worlds fastest office chair, A flying jeep, An army of ponys with SMG's lead by Rainbow dash, A Rainbow Dash with an SMG lead by an army of ponies, A TF2 spy eating a sentry, A sentry eating a spy, A toilet, An explosive toilet or a thing that is nothing to do with toilets, you can build it. Best of all you can do all this in the universe of Half Life 2 and link games using Source such as Tf2 or Portal. This game is the perfect game for the people out there Gifted with the talent of creativeness and create screenshots (Or attempt to if your me), or if you just like killing stuff. 2,000,000,000/10 =D

game-hours: 17.5
review: Fun
game-hours: 221.9
review: It's hard to accurately describe WHAT Garry's Mod is as a video game. If anything: It's a platform thanks to the ease of downloading a seemingly infinite number of user-created models/toys/vehicles/weapons/what-have-you to play with. There are no goals to Gmod's default sandbox mode. Everything is limited by your imagination, which is a good and bad thing. Good in the sense that creativity is rewarded with the creation of silly, yet potentially complex contraptions which you can drive, detonate, ride, fling etc. But bad in the sense of how well game with no goal can keep you occupied for an extended period of time. The real fun of Garry's Mod spawns from building your own enjoyment with your friends! Multiplayer is where this game truely shines, allowing for a massive level of server modding and customisation. You're not only restricted to building stuff in this game. Want to play a game of who-dunnit where detectives try to discover discreet murderers among their ranks? Want to watch Youtube videos in a virtual cinema with friends? Hide and seek? Roleplay? Survival? All of this and more is avaliable thanks to Gmod's incredible modding community. Unfortunately, to gain the full experience from this title, other Source games like Counter-Strike: Source and Half-Life 2 are strongly recommended to make use of their assets. You have to find your own fun with Garry's Mod, but once you've found it expect your play time to skyrocket.

game-hours: 212.5
review: Positives: 1.) Not very cpu intensive unless you make it (which I have found relatively difficult to do). 2.) Great pricing. 3.) Great for playing with friends. 4.) You can imagine it, You can build it. 5.) Possibly others I forgot about. Negatives: 1.) Can get boring in single player relatively quickly but if you have friends to play with that is an easy fix. 2.) When using the easy-weld function of the weld tool sometimes the objects will launch across the map. Nothing major with that one though. 3.) A lack of an "official" in-game tutorial but it is somewhat easy enough to figure out by reading the hints. 4.) Possibly others I forgot about. Overall: Graphics 8.7/10 Gameplay 9.5/10 Edit: Be sure to note that I did not review the community as this is meant to be a review of the game not the people who play it.

game-hours: 18.1
review: A Review of Garry's Mad: 3.6 / 5.2 thumbs up This game would have scored higher if the plot was resolved at the end. That's my biggest beef with it and I felt it had to be addressed right off the bat. Why is Garry mad? No clue. The plot does not make it obvious and I have been to various message forums looking for an answer to no avail. Second, the multiplayer aspect could use some work. It is trying to be too many games at once. In one map, I was a traitor and hunted down by a detective with a sonic the hedgehog mask on, yet in another I was witness to a spiral mechanic dragon rampaging through a quiet peaceful lake shore as other players on the shore built contraptions to do battle with it. I wish the game would pick one thing to be and not be anything else as it is very hard for me to coincide conflicting ideas.

review: Its Community, though a tad more toxic, and younger then originally, is a generally clean and friendly community, welcoming to new players and rewarding to active ones. Garry's Mod presents itself as a platform, with the tools to create insanely entertaining gamemodes such as DarkRP, Trouble in Terrorist Town, Prophunt, Sandbox and more. With its cheap $10.00 price tag, and entertaining and even as far to say investing gameplay, and awesome community, Garry's Mod should be owned by every human being on this Earth! I truly recommend this game as a 10/10. Collectively on two accounts I have 6500+ hours, having it for 5 years. A sidenote for GMod Veterans: Rest in piece, Garry's Mod 10, 11, and 12. 13 has proven to be better for developers (and therefore players) but - I will never forget the golden years. game-hours: 258.7
review: Garry's Mod (stylized as garry's mod; often abbreviated as GMOD) is a sandbox physics game using a modified Source engine, created by Garry Newman. Garry's Mod was originally a mod for Valve's Half-Life 2, but was later made into a standalone game. Although Garry's Mod is listed as a full game, it has no objectives and instead gives the player a sandbox to manipulate items free of restrictions, although some multiplayer servers use role-play or other game modes created by players. Garry's Mod allows players to manipulate items, furniture and "props"  various objects that players can place in-game. Props can be selected from any installed Source engine game or from a community created collection. The game features two "guns", the Physics Gun and Tool Gun, for manipulating objects. The Physics Gun allows objects to be picked up, adjusted, and frozen in place. The Tool Gun is a multi-purpose tool for performing various tasks, such as combining props, attaching them via ropes, and creating controllable winches and wheels. The Tool Gun is also used to control add-ons created by the community. Another popular Garry's Mod concept is rag-doll posing. The player can instantiate a rag-doll model from a Source game and pose it using a variety of tools.[3] This is a popular tool for making fan-made videos and machinimas.

review: I like Garry's Mod as a game I can play with my friends sometimes, and when none of my friends are there to play I can mess around with addons and wreck it by installing too many. I myself as a 13 year old think it's very funny and hilarious to mess around in. But of course all games do get to a point where they just aren't fun anymore. Just a warning for people who think this game is cool, it will get boring in about 3 years tops, keep playing this game every week, once a week if you want to get fun out of it and make it last. Garry's Mod is amazing overall, it's a game to keep and I hope Garry Newman can take a break from Rust sometime and check back in on his genius mod that became an fantastic standalone game. And the thing about wrecking the game with addons, yeah um... don't ever exceed 400 addons or you won't be very happy. game-hours: 138.9
review: Garry's Mod is the brainchild of Garry Newman, who wanted to create a physics-based sandbox based on the Source engine which also allows other players to create mods for the game too. So the game has a truly MASSIVE amount of variety. In singleplayer, you canbuild your own NPC arena, populate it with conflicting characters and watch them kill each other. On zombie survival, be a human fighting for your life while a zombie horde slowly infects the rest of your band of survivors. On Trouble in Terrorist Town, take control of a 'Traitor' Terrorist, and collaborate with other Traitors to wipe out all the 'Innocent' Terrorists, either through the use of a suicide bomb or sniping each innocent off, one by one. And in the excellent Dark RP, a multiplater role-playing mod built for the game, you start of as a citizen, but if you wish you can choose a different job, such as a police officer and take on crime head-on, or a mob boss with a gang the size of everyone in the server called 'The Tunnel Snakes' who own the cops through successful blackmail and bribery, or a sadistic gun dealer who's only pleasure is to kill everyone he sees, or a hobo and beg for money, or a hitman charging $100 per kill. Or in the fantastic ''Prop Hunt'' where you either start off as a hunter and fend your way to slaughter all props which hide,or be a prop and hide hoping no-one will find you-personally this and Trouble in terrorist town Are my favorites.-Or just be a citizen and build. The game is fantastic, with the only flaws being the aged (but highly forgiveable) graphics and the occasional glitches and LUA cache errors. But I don't usually judge games based on minor technical problems. I judge them on the experience I've had with the game. And mine was fantastic.9.9/10 .1 Off because lua errors,Otherwise great game,Great!I recomend it,seriously buy it now if you havn't.
game-hours: 35.0
review: THRUSTERS EVERYWHERE. EVERYONE IS DEAD SO MUCH DEATH. I HAVE DAILY FLASHBACKS OF THE WAR BECAUSE OF THIS I likely have more hilarious physics related deaths than a dozen play-throughs of DarkSouls. This game is worth everything I payed and more. And unless you're about as creative as a rock you'll definitely enjoy the sh t out of this game.

game-hours: 3332.8
review: Now..where do I begin? This game is more like a few hundered games in one. There are so many game modes to play there's no way I can talk about them all, so I'll just talk about the two most popular gamemodes, sandbox and TTT. Sandbox: You can load up any map you want, then spawn in and mess around with various props, NPC's, vehicles, and weapons. With the addon system, you can spawn in a crazy amount of stuff created by other players. Will you build a giant castle out of plastic blocks? Or will you spawn in an army of rebels to fight a combine horde? Your choice. Trouble in terrorist town: Essentially a murder mystery game. You're the terrorists from counter-strike, but someone's a traitor among you, but you don't know who. It's the innocent's job to find out who the traitor is and kill him before he kills everyone else. You could randomly kill people (not a good idea) or you could use evidence to find the traitors and exterminate them.

game-hours: 121.4
review: Huh..can't believe I haven't written a review on this game yet, well here it goes. Garry's Mod is a physics sandbox. Unlike regular games there aren't any predefined aims or goals. You are given the tools and leave you to play. You spawn objects and weld them together to create your own contraptions - whether that's a car, a rocket, a catapult or something that doesn't have a name yet - that's up to you. If you're not too great at construction - don't worry! You can place a variety of characters in silly positions, there are also a large variety of game modes as well like: Trouble in Terrorist Town, where there are innocent terrorists and traitor terrorists, the traitor must kill all the innocents before the innocents find out who the traitor is. Stop Slender! Where players are to roam around a map collecting eight pages, BUT there is one player who takes control of Slenderman, his goal is to kill everyone looking for pages. There are a whole variety of gamemodes but it'll take me forever to go through them all. Garry's Mod is a fun sandbox game which allows you to do and construct whatever you like. Here's a score for what I think: 9/10 Now excuse me, I need to construct my top secret scientific titanium plated rocket ship. P.S this game includes THOUSANDS OF MODS for your enjoyment! (hence Garry's 'MOD')

review: One does not simply review Garry's Mod. Like, seriously. No one could possibly describe this game. If you can think it, it probably can exist in Garry's Mod. There are gamemodes that are so awesome, well, yeah. They're amazing. You have Trouble in Terrorist Town and Murder, your very own psychopath simulators/stealth games. You have a number of different Roleplaying types, including DarkRP, MafiaRP, Star Wars RP, GangWarsRP (I think), and a number of other bizarre roleplaying types. You have your random gamemodes, like SledBuild (building a sled and racing it), Flood (build your raft, try to survive the oncoming fight), and the infamous GMOD Tower, which is like Garry's Mod inside Garry's Mod. With hats. Yeah, it's pretty awesome.

game-hours: 204.4
review: At face value, Garry's mod is a quirky, hilarious and seriously addictive Source Engine based physics/sandbox game which allows you to make anything out of, well, anything; as well as letting you play many hundreds of different gamemodes- my personal favourite being the classic "Trouble in Terrorist Town" mode which sees a group of "terrorists" being split into a group of "innocents" and "traitors" in some sort of murder mystery/cluedo arrangement, with the innocents furiously trying to identify (and kill) the traitors before they themselves end up six foot below and peppered with gunshot. A very fun and challenging gamemode which really lets you see the worst in people; well worth the 5.99 paid for the game on it's own. However, this description really doesn't do the game, with its many addons, gamemodes and mods, justice; just buy it and try it out for yourself. Seriously, stop reading this and buy it. game-hours: 77.1
review: If you are reading this and this game isn't in your library, you're an idiot. Seriously, this is one of steam's best games and arguably one of the best games ever. Well, it isn't a game per say, but it's close enough. It is an open source engine that takes props, maps and characters from other games made from the source engine and allows you to do as you want. Make a deep and meaningful adventure game, make a platformer that makes people want to pull their teeth out or just put characters from Half-Life and Counter-Strike in random sex positions and giggle. This game is truly the perfect game as there is infinite things to do in it. If you aren't too imaginitive you can always jump online and play TTT or Prop Hunt or one of the millions of other game modes that other, more intelligent(or just more nerdy), people have made. A must have for PC gamers everywhere especially since you can pick it up for no more than 3 dollars when it is on sale. 10/10

game-hours: 324.7
review: Garry's Mod is a very fun (and old) physics playground. I have played over 200 hours of this, and have gotten tons of user made add-ons to my G-mod toolbox to add to my gameplay experience, and I love it! Garrys Mod over-all is a very fun Physics sandbox that allows pretty much anything to happen, Excellent AI, AMAZING Physics, and over-all fun. A few bugs and things: Sometimes, the steam cloud crashes, and you temporarily lose your add-ons. Also, LAN Servers are very buggy, and it is nearly impossible to host a LAN game, even with LogMeInHamachi. There is no censor, at all, there is global voice chat on servers, so be warned. And sometimes people upload innapropriate things to the add-ons, and "Dupes" tab. A few things with physics are buggy, but very few things. Conclusion. Overall, Garry's mod is very fun, addicting, entertaining, great physics simulator, and so on... I would deffinetly recommend this game, totally worth 10 USD Although some things can be a bit buggy, if you can get this, I say BUY IT and it is a really big score if you happen to catch this while it is on sale.

game-hours: 189.8
review: I've had Garry's Mod since GM9 came out, and I've had hours upon hours of fun with it. It can be a springboard for creativity - a look at the Facepunch Games forums, or any Source movie created before the advent of Valve's SFM will make that clear. But, I've found that you MUST HAVE A PLAN when you sit down to play. Plan to play multiplayer. Plan to build an airship. Plan to program a missile launcher in WireMod. Heck, you can teach yourself about the applications of vector calculus using WireMod. But if you stumble into the sandbox with no plan at all, you WILL waste vast amounts of time before you do anything really satisfying. Explore the goofiness and the mods for a few hours, but if you're like me, a plan will help you get a lot more out of Gmod in the end. Play something with a narrative if you want to goof off. Garry's Mod is hard - and potentially rewarding - work. :)

game-hours: 168.5
review: Very fun! You can do anything from making a scene to making a zombie invasion! Or a roket! The posibilities are endless. I definitally recommend this game. It's perfect for people who just want to do their own thing. You can play single player or multiplayer, wich is AWESOME! I aspecially like the fact that you can make your own stuff and then put it on the workshop for other people to see and use. Going on servers though, that's a pain. You need to download the stuff that's in the server. So it could take HOURS for you to go into a server. But if you have the stuff, then it doesn't take long (depending on your connection.). MANY, I reapeat, MANY things can go wrong. By that I mean: Glitches, crashes, and freezing. Depending on how good your computer is, you can only do so much. If, for example, you wanted a zombie infested map, you'd have to have a good gaming computer. Otherwize your computer will lag, freeze or even crash. I'm not saying this game isn't bad at all. I'm just pointing out some stuff that could be worked on. Other then that, this game is AWESOME! I love it, my sister loves it, my dad loves it, my friends love it. It's a very lovable game. :) :) :) Ten out of ten, I'd say.

game-hours: 1951.6
review: One of my favorite games, Garry's Mod is a sandbox game that uses the source engine props, such as Half Life 2 and Counter Strike, the game has been molded from just being a creation game like Minecraft, to being a very diverse experience, the different Gametypes such as DarkRP, Perp, Citylife, Trouble in Terrorist Town, Prophunt and so many more, this game was made more by server communities and modders than the devs, which make it amazing, the devs just went "Go nuts" and we did! A must buy for anyone that's on Steam, this is the FIRST game you get ! Although, the community in different servers is very different, on servers such as CitylifeRP and PERP, players attempt to get you banned more than playing the game, which is a bit of a problem. Also, some people ruin the game for others called 'Minges' or 'Griefers' there are a large amount of these, though, any good server can deal with them with a quick ban hammer to the face. Gameplay: 10/10 Graphics: Variable Modding Ability: 10/10 Fun: 10/10 People: 4/10

game-hours: 1728.9
review: Garry's Mod is a game, mainly played in first person, but with some tweaks in the developer's console, you can make it into third person. Garry's Mod uses the source engine, allowing you to code and make you're own gamemodes, maps, items, etc. (Add-ons) Garry's mod is both single-player and multiplayer, there is a variety of gamemodes, and new ones being made all of the time, some failing, but some succeeding. This game does get boring if you do have only the vanilla version of it, as in, without any add-ons, considering if you want to join any other server besides sandbox, you are going to have to download at least one add-on, because when you have the vanilla version, it leads you to limited maps, limited items and things to do, while when you go onto the Garry's Mod workshop, then you can see that there are thousands and thousands of things that you can download to help making your gaming expericence with Garry's Mod the best it can be. I personally love the game, considering at the time of making this review I have over 1,600 hours on the game. But the Vanilla and singleplayer can get boring. If you were to want to play with your friends on a private server, either one of you is going to have to be paying for a server and just put a password on it or you are going to have to use a third-party program such as Hamachi or GameRanger to create a server that only you and your friends can connect to. All and all, this is a good game and I would really recommend that you pick it up, the price for such a game is really cheap Final game rating: 9/10

game-hours: 212.5
review: Positives: 1.) Not very cpu intensive unless you make it (which I have found relatively difficult to do). 2.) Great pricing. 3.) Great for playing with friends. 4.) You can imagine it, You can build it. 5.) Possibly others I forgot about. Negatives: 1.) Can get boring in single player relatively quickly but if you have friends to play with that is an easy fix. 2.) When using the easy-weld function of the weld tool sometimes the objects will launch across the map. Nothing major with that one though. 3.) A lack of an "official" in-game tutorial but it is somewhat easy enough to figure out by reading the hints. 4.) Possibly others I forgot about. Overall: Graphics 8.7/10 Gameplay 9.5/10 Edit: Be sure to note that I did not review the community as this is meant to be a review of the game not the people who play it.

game-hours: 3802.9
review: Garry's Mod (often abbreviated as GMOD) is a sandbox physics game using a modified Source engine, created by Garry Newman. Garry's Mod was originally a modification for Valve's Half-Life 2, but was later made into a standalone game. Although Garry's Mod is listed as a full game, it has no objectives and instead gives the player a sandbox to manipulate items free of restrictions, although some multiplayer servers use role-play or other game modes created by players. Garry's Mod allows players to manipulate items, furniture and "props"  various objects that players can place in-game. Props can be selected from any installed Source engine game or from a community created collection. The game features two "guns"  Physics Gun and Tool Gun for manipulating objects. The Physics Gun allows objects to be picked up, adjusted, and frozen in place. The Tool Gun is a multi-purpose tool for performing various tasks, such as combining props, attaching them via ropes, and creating controllable winches and wheels. The Tool Gun is also used to control add-ons created by the community. Garry's Mod has been available on Valve's content delivery service Steam since November 29, 2006. In the past, purchasing Garry's Mod required the user to own at least one game on Steam based on the Source engine, such as Valve's Half-Life 2, Counter-Strike: Source, Portal, or Team Fortress 2, however as of May 2014 the game can be purchased by itself on Steam. It is also commonly used for the creation and publishing of videos on YouTube, mainly from Team Fortress 2, Half-Life 2, Portal, Left 4 Dead and Left 4 Dead 2. Garry's Mod was originally a modification for Half-Life 2, but was later made into a standalone Steam game that was officially released on November 29, 2006 dubbed Garry's Mod 10. The current version, Garry's Mod 14.04.04, was released on April 4, 2014. In February 2014 it was revealed on Twitter by Newman that the game had "just broke" US$ 30 million. As of November 2013 the game has sold 3.5 million copies. So I would recommend this game.

review: There is so much you can do with Garry's Mod. If you learn the coding required to make garry's mod content, (LUA coding) then you can just about make anything you want. If you don't know or want to learn LUA coding, that completely fine because there is already so much custom content already made by other players that you can be distracted by one gamemode for months on end, then move to the next one when you are bored. I'm not even  you, I have played the (insert bad word here) out of Garry's Mod and there is still so much I haven't gotten to do. This game is so big it has practically 100's of communities so if you don't like one, then move on to the next community. This is literally what would happen if half life had a multiplayer and sandbox mode. The best multiplayer game ever 100/10. There is also an exceptionally entertaining singleplayer mode if you have an untrustworthy internet connection.

review: Garry's Mod is a physics sandbox. Unlike regular games there aren't any predefined aims or goals. The game's makers give you the tools and leave you to play! You spawn objects and weld them together to create your own contraptions -- whether that's a car, a rocket, a catapult or something that doesn't have a name yet -- that's up to you. If you're not too great at construction -- don't worry! You can place a variety of characters in silly positions.

review: BEFORE BUYING THE GAME: Make sure you have a few other Source games like Half-Life 2 and CSS otherwise you will have a lot of problems joining servers because textures/models will be missing. Review: This game is simply amazing, it's not difficult to learn and there's a lot, I seriously mean a lot of content to be explored. Everything from basic "sandbox" where you can build crazy contraptions to serious RP'ing on servers with the DarkRP/CityRP/other RP gamemodes. You could say that this game has something for everyone. Pros: + Physics sandbox + Requires little effort to learn, but has a lot of depth with addons like Wire + Immense amounts of content in gamemodes and addons Cons: - Long loading times on servers with a lot of content - Some gamemodes/addons can be low quality - Practically requires you to buy CSS/HL2

game-hours: 3290.2
review: A game for true gangsters.
game-hours: 804.4
review: Garry's Mod isn't really that much of a "game". If we looked at it in detail, it's a sandbox environment. You create and enjoy. Start with building a box, then a car or tank, and then move up to flying a plane -- all made from HL2 objects. When you get bored of that, you can move into gamemodes. This is what "gmod" is known for. It's a game within a game. Since garry's mod is open, anyone can code a new game with LUA and run it off a server for people to play on. Try Trouble in Terrorist Town, maybe a roleplay game, or the good old classic build. Whatever you choose, it's your game. Powered by Source, garry's mod allows for a lot of customization. Building off of the trusted engine, LUA and the workshop expand the sandbox game into truely infinite playtime. Seriously worth the $10 you have sitting in your wallet. 8.5/10
game-hours: 20.1
review: Without a doubt, the most customizable game in existence.
game-hours: 197.5
review: I liked this game right from the start. It was fun and an awesome break from staring a HL2 for 100 hours. The object of this game is simple: Screw around. It has a very fun aura about its appearance, and an interesting tweakable experience to its gameplay and features. This game is helped very much by Steam Community Workshop support. Without variety, this game would be very bland and easily boring. Sandbox is no fun without Workshop addons. Games get boring after awhile, excluding a few (The Binding Of Isaac, Fallout: New Vegas, etc.). This one would, but it has Workshop support. I personally would rate this game 9.2/10! From your friendly neighborhood panda, Pandamonium456

review: trouble in terrorist town: this is the most popular gamemode and i am always on edge. basicly there are tratoirs and the innocent and the detectives. the traitors must take out the innocent by picking them off secretly when they are alone. the innocent must fight to survive and stay together so the traiotors will not kill them. and the dtectives must find out who the traitors are by checking dead bodies. this gamemode is fun because it doesn't show other people if you are a traitor or innocent so its easy to mistake someone for a traitor and kill them making you look like a trator when the person who is right next to them is traitor! the traitors have an array of traps and weapons that they can buy to kill the innocent, people still searching the bulding to get you? plant a bomb and jump out the window and blow the sky (^*&^&%ing high! the detectives have tools but not the same tools as the traitors, did two traitors lure you away and start shooting you? use the spiderman gun and grapple your away from them just before you take a fatal blow to the face. its good fun and i highly recomend it.

game-hours: 2166.7
review: A truly unmissable game. There's something for everybody in this game, and I guarantee it. Jam packed with gamemodes, you'll never get tired of this game. Not only that, people can upload custom content that THEY made onto the steam workshop. Weapons, props, playermodels, maps, you name it! This game is powered by the source engine, which is perfect for this game. You can also mount most source games (There are exceptions.) to the Garry's Mod. You can use props and models from those games in YOUR GAME! Now, the catch. This game runs best with Counter Strike: Source. (CS:S) This is because most of the maps made by the community (Which is just about the majority of the playable maps in the game.) use textures and props from CS:S. If you do not have CS:S, most maps will be mostly composed of a purple and black grid, and the word error. There are other ways to get the textures. (SteamCMD, Steam Free Weekend, etc.) If you have the money for Garry's Mod, I highly reccomnd buying it. BYEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!

game-hours: 125.8
review: Guys, why are you even reading the reviews? It's quite simple actually, You just click buy and then you can play. But hey if you are still reading I might give you some info about this one. Let's keep it short, This is a game with cool physics and ragdoll stuff. Sandbox mode is the actual standard mode in which you can build everthing you want, you can save your creations and load it in another map, also you can just load creations from other people. BUT, there is much more than sandbox mode, this game includes many modes which you can consider games of their own. For example TTT in which there is one or multiple traitor(s) in a group of terrorist, the traitor(s) has/have to wipe out all terrorists and the terrorists have to wipe out the traitor(s). * Conclusion: Gmod is a must have, you won't regret it. *I really recommend you buying the Garry's Mod + Counter Strike: source pack because many textures from CSS are being used in the game, otherwise you'll get black/purple colored textures.

game-hours: 97.6
review: Garry's Mod is a creative sandbox game filled with various custom game modes and items made from the Workshop. Garry's Mod is a fun experience, especially if you have friends to play with. You can literally create anything...the game allows you to be a ruler of your own world. After you're done with single player, you can try multiplayer. Gamemodes are interesting to play, but some require Counter Strike Source. Trouble in Terrorist Town pits the Innocent and Traitor terrorists against each other, but there's a catch; the innocent don't know which players are their enemy. Murder is also a fun gamemode. Players are together and unaware of who is the murderer, who is tasked to kill everyone including the bystander with the secret weapon. Garry's Mod is popular and great to play.

game-hours: 249.2
review: Best. Game. Ever. Period. Well, this is an "in-depth" review sooo... First of all, you can never be bored on this game and you will always be doing something crazy, unless you're a serious person. The more creative you are, the better. You can build many structures and even build robots with all the tools at your disposal. There are ragdolls, props, vehicles, and many maps to offer. The game gets even better when you add the workshop. The community makes content that you can download and there are in-game community-made dupes that you can screw around with. Garry's Mod also has spawned many ridiculous and fun gamemodes, like GMod Tower, Trouble in Terrorist Town (TTT), Prop Hunt, Murder, STOP IT! Slender, and many more. Overall, this game is totally worth $9.99 (that is how much I bought it for) and it should be worth more because you can play games within a game in GMod. That is crazy, much like this game.

game-hours: 1239.3
review: Graphics - While graphics don't make a game, they certainly help you understand what's going on. Garry's Mod has similar graphics to Half-Life 2, running on the same engine and having most of the items in Half-Life in-game. In other words, they look alright. 4/5. Music - Garry's Mod contains hardly any music. To be fair, players can create items that play music, and some music can be ported from other games. 2/5. Story - No story here. Make your own! Power to the players! 4/5. Replayability - There is no start, and no end to this game. It's always fun to come back and slaughter combine, build a city, or just mess around. 5/5. Gameplay - How you play is up to you. Build or destory, it's always fun. Many community-made gamemodes to explore, you're bound to find one you enjoy. 5/5 Overall Score - 4/5 Good.

game-hours: 4347.2
review: Originally envisioned as a sourcemod that'd let you put Alyx in lewd positions, Garry's Mod has grown to be much more than just a sandbox; with the core of most of its playerbase in various multiplayer gamemodes that players themselves have created. Ranging from the plethora of different non-serious roleplaying gamemodes to the classic gamemode, sandbox and to fast games like TTT, Deathrun, and zombie survival. You'd already be getting your money's worth by just buying it to play for one gamemode as each one generally has significant replay value. Take note that there is no officially run gmod servers and most if not all are run by private individuals who have free reign over what they want to do with their server. If they want to, they can turn DarkRP into DonateRP, Trouble in Terrorist Town into Trouble in RDM Town, Zombie Survival into Unbalanced Survival. The point is, although you'll be spending a lot of time playing, you'll also be spending a lot of time finding a server that just doesn't suck. If you find a server that you just fit into, the game just becomes more fun and worth your money. In short, although most of the playerbase may not be that great, there are a few really good servers floating around. I would most definitely recommend this game. I've already played way more hours than anyone should and I still find it fun.
game-hours: 84.9
review: Awesome "game", but only for creative people. It's hard to build anything complicated, but still I would recommend it if you want to have some fun.
game-hours: 562.7
review: I never really wanted to write a review for any game, but this game sure deserved one. This game changed what a game was. Garry's Mod is a game of endless possibilities. What ever you couldn't do or wanted to do in a game, you can do in garry's mod. Along with the workshop for garry's mod you can download tons of addons, that it be a car from a game or one some one has made, a favorite character from another game or one someone has made, or even a map from another game or one someone has created. You name it, the workshop has it. If it doesn't have what your looking for, then make it and publish it to the workshop for yourself and others to enjoy! If your creative and or have an imagination, or just want to be able to do what you want, this game is for you. I would recommend this game to everyone. Now with every great game, it comes with its down sides. The only bad thing i can say about this game is if you want the full experience you will have to buy some other source games. Some of those games are Team Fortress 2(which is free on steam), Counter-Strike: Source, Half life 2, Portol, Left for Dead, etc. Though if you have Team Fortress 2, Counter-Strike Source, and Half Life 2 you should be good to go. But if you don't have the money for those other source games and don't mind seeing the occasional purple and black checker board(garry's mod owners know what im talking about) then i highly recommend this game to everyone.

game-hours: 172.8
review: I don't know why this game exists but I love every second of it... Garry's Mod was recommended to me by friends and despite being put off by it's rather vague description of a sandbox game where you have to download more things in it and it's somewhat wacky screenshots, I caved in, sold all of my Team Fortress 2 items and bought it. And I've not regretted it once. This game is difficult to grasp there's no denying that but when you join a public server and see a load of Half Life characters flying around the map with big blue laser guns attached onto Team Fortress 2 props and characters and then get a message that the server has crashed, think to yourself how much fun people are having with this game. It does exactly what it claims. It gives you the tools and leaves you to play. And ANYTHING can be done in this game. You can have a battle with another player, make a Horseless Headless Horseman sit on a sofa and watch TV, dangle Dr. Isaac Kleiner from a Mann Co. crane or even slaughter Teletubbies while escaping the clutches of Freddy Fazbear and friends on an Imperial Star Destroyer. There are no limits.....until the game crashes. Which WILL happen. So be mindful of what you spawn in. This game takes patience. Lots of it. So give it. There's no telling what monstrocities or works of art you might end uo making. Just find a friend of someone willing to expain it to you or even make your own discoveries in this magical world of Balloonicorns, Vortigaunts and Metal Gears.... 10/10

game-hours: 77.3
review: Garry's mod is a creative singleplayer and multiplayer sandbox game. You can do a lot of things, from making fantastic working machines to just having fun by posing ragdolls around. What i really love about garry's mod is that you can download over 150,000 mods, weapons, ragdolls, skins, maps, the list goes on and on. When you start garry's mod, you can either do singleplayer, where you can choose a map to be in and make stuff, and do a ton of other things. or you can do multiplayer, where you can grab a few of your friends and play on a sandbox server and have fun together. Or you can find new friends and go play prop hunt, or trouble in terrorist town, or a lot of other game modes. I would recommend this game to pretty much every creative person, or even people who just want to blow stuff up. There is so much to do on garry's mod, that you won't run out of things to do. There's constantly new add-ons to get. Well, i hope this review helps you choose whether or not you want to get this game or not. If you find this review helpful, please leave a thumbs up!
