review: In a sea of bland darkRP servers and uninspired TTT clones, one stands above them all. Hellsgamer's is the pinnacle of excellence. They raise the bar in aspects. The gameplay itself is flawless, with humans spawncamping the zombie team with a diverse pool of weapons for the entirety of the game, never faltering. The sublime selection of levels the server has to offer is astounding, with five second fps black holes, to hallways longer than the sun, truly remarkable. Finally, the friendly community that has kept this gamemode ahead of the pack. With in-game points for sale, with real money, the spawncamping never ceases. They have set the bar for administration, banning members of the Noxiousnet community, who's version of zombiesurvival is undoubtedly superior. The brave new world Hellsgamers has created for us is waiting to be explored.

review: Guys, why are you even reading the reviews? It's quite simple actually, You just click buy and then you can play. But hey if you are still reading I might give you some info about this one. Let's keep it short, This is a game with cool physics and ragdoll stuff. Sandbox mode is the actual standard mode in which you can build everthing you want, you can save your creations and load it in another map, also you can just load creations from other people. BUT, there is much more than sandbox mode, this game includes many modes which you can consider games of their own. For example TTT in which there is one or multiple traitor(s) in a group of terrorist, the traitor(s) has/have to wipe out all terrorists and the terrorists have to wipe out the traitor(s). * Conclusion: Gmod is a must have, you won't regret it. *I really recommend you buying the Garry's Mod + Counter Strike: source pack because many textures from CSS are being used in the game, otherwise you'll get black/purple colored textures.

game-hours: 1.5
review: 7/10 This game is extremely hilarious, Scary, and Maddening all at the same time. With games like Prophunt, and Murder, this game is extremely fun, with the right people. There is however LOTS of set up you have to do to get it to work. You have to first Download the game. Then go into the game, and start downloading the game mode you want to play. Okay got it? Now here comes the tricky part. Each Server uses a different map pack usually. And to be able to play, you need the exact one the server is hosted on. Pretty much if one thing is off, you can't play on the server using the map. So you have to go through the steam workshop (or, use the ingame downloader. I prefer the workshop because then you have the search), and look at what server you want to get. Then look for the map theyre using in the Workshop, and download it. It will take a LOT to find the certain one they use though considering there is about 10 of the same map usually (just with different alterations). Once you finally have the certain map and gamemode installed you're free to play! That is of course, until the server switches maps... Then you will get kicked off the server if you dont have the map. and youll have to follow the above steps again. ITS STILL REALLY FUN THOUGH. Don't get me wrong, I LOVE GARRY'S MOD. this game is amazing. But the amount of stuff you have to go through to set everything up, you really have to wonder if it is worth it. Luckily after you buy the game, there is nothing else you'll need to buy. Everything else is free. It just takes forever to figure out what you need, and can be extremely confusing if you don't have someone to talk you through it. GET IT if you think you can figure all of this out. If you have NO KNOWLEDGE with how to work steam... or a computer in general, dont get this game. You'll find yourself Extremely confused, and not able to play the game (You can't really do anything unless you get stuff from the workshop).

review: There is so much you can do with Garry's Mod. If you learn the coding required to make garry's mod content, (LUA coding) then you can just about make anything you want. If you don't know or want to learn LUA coding, that completely fine because there is already so much custom content already made by other players that you can be distracted by one gamemode for months on end, then move to the next one when you are bored. I'm not even  you, I have played the (insert bad word here) out of Garry's Mod and there is still so much I haven't gotten to do. This game is so big it has practically 100's of communities so if you don't like one, then move on to the next community. This is literally what would happen if half life had a multiplayer and sandbox mode. The best multiplayer game ever 100/10. There is also an exceptionally entertaining singleplayer mode if you have an untrustworthy internet connection.

game-hours: 389.6
review: The Gmod community is huge, approaching the likes of L4D2, Portal 2, or even getting to the stage of Team Fortress 2 (At least if it weren't FtP). This means new servers, new addons, new workshop creations, all new each day. It is never the same game twice, unless you choose it to be of course. It is possible to mount games on Gmod, so long as they run on the Source engine. Even so, this means your content from The Half Life games (Source), Portal and L4D series, Team Fortress 2 and many other games are all able to be mounted from the word go. And, arguably the best thing about Gmod, is the fact that you can do ANYTHING. Not like most 'realistic' first person shooters which say "Hop on your bike. You can go anywhere you like! (So long as it's in this general direction.)" No. If you can think of it, then it can be made. And yes, there are some pretty crazy things out there, but that makes it all the more fun. 10/10

game-hours: 74.6
review: It's a grat game to be sure but it does have it's flaws. E.g It dosen't tell you that you need to have the couter-strike: source texture pack to play games without having a errors signs and purple and blcak squares showing up. You can buy a bundle where you can get these both for a discount but it isn't clear that you need the textures until you're playing a game with giant "error" as a table. Plus it feels like you were scammed when you find out. You can get them from free online but if you don't trust the web I recommend just buying counter-strike: source (which costs more than the actual game...). But it is a great game beside that with plenty of different game modes along with some role playing games. The games are unique, like prop hunt when you would turn into a object as a hider and hide, while th hunters would try and find you and shoot you and your team down. Overall it's agreat game but it does have a few tricks up it's sleve.

game-hours: 207.3
review: Garry's Mod is one of the most creative games available on steam. This game is pure sandbox. In free building you can do whatever comes to your mind. Building things recquires some practise, and sometimes watching tutorials, but after few hours of playing you'll know how to use most of the tools. And then, you can create amazing things and post them to the workshop in order to show people your creations. Some people say gmod isn't a game, it's some sort of tool to create. They are wrong. Gmod, thanks to steam workshop has tons of gamemodes, which make it one of the most hilarious multiplayer games ever. For example we have Trouble in Terrorist Town (TTT) - the rules are simple: there is a group of terrorists. Most of people are innocent, but there are traitors. Innocent must survive, and traitors must kill all the innocents. There is also a detective, who tries to investigate who the traitors are. In workshop you can find thousands of items which will make the game even more fun. The other interesting mods are: deathrun (where you have to run past maaaaaany traps activated by other players), cinema (you can watch movies from yt with your friends), prop hunt (hide n' seek, with changing into props), pirate ship wars (i dont think i have to explain it :D), all kinds of RP (you get a certain role in a society, for example a cop, a dealer, mafia boss etc.), Stop It Slender (Slender multiplayer, where one of the players is a Slender), and many, many others. In the end i wanted to say, that i really recommend Garry's Mod to everyone, who likes to have fun with friends or random people, or wants to do something creative. + The game is really cheap and during the sales you can buy it for like 2 euro or less.

game-hours: 741.0
review: Take the Source Engine, add a few building tool, some good maps and a wide variety of objects to use. That's just the BASE of Garry's Mod. Not only can you mount different games to get more content to create contraptions, screenshots, poses, custom maps, ect., but you can also download addons from a (somewhat) amazing community, like gamemodes, weapons, more objects to build with, fun little contraptions, better tools, and things to help you make a server. Speaking of servers, you can easily create a server to play with your friends by creating a LAN Server, using a program such as hamachi, or even portfowarding. I have played over 550 hours, and over half of that time is on servers. This game is usually 10 (US) dollars as you can see below, but I suggest waiting for it to go on sale for 5 or even 2.5 dollars. If you want everything you need, you should buy the CS+Gmod bundle. It's great for getting started, as most of the gamemodes, maps, and addons require it. Just buy this game, if you like infinitely expanding sandbox games.

game-hours: 413.6
review: This game is a open sandbox where you can do anything! Pros - Many dedicated servers for various gamemodes. - Community made stuff to enhance the experience. - Uses easy to learn script language, "LUA" so you can make your own custom stuff easily. - Creativity can run loose on this game. - RAGDOLL FUN! - Cheap price (on sale too). - GMan staring at you. (   ) - Funny as hell (trust me). Cons - It may take some time to find a good server of your preference due to the many squeakers/s on this game. - Takes time to load servers if it has a few addons/additions. - Uses textures from other games like Counter-Strike:Source and others which will appear as errors to many of the players if they do not have all the game's texutres. - Some weird fetish  on some servers (you'll see some on DarkRP). Rating Overall, I rate this game a 7.8/10. It is a fun game to play with friends which will keep you playing for hours on end, however, there are many things you must do first in order to actually 'start playing' (download CS textures and content, find a decent server without annoying /or download hamachi and make a private server, and wait for some time depending on how many addons the server has). Bought it for like $5, and I'll tell you, it's WORTH IT.

game-hours: 200.8
review: I bought this game after I bought Half-Life 2 (HL2). It was so fun I decided to get some more games made ont eh Source SDK Base engine. You know, games like HL2, Left 4 Dead... and Garry's Mod. I was skeptical about buying it, considering it has "Mod" in the name. I bought it, and its my most played game in my library. I passes Left 4 Dead, HL2, Terraria, etc. With many gametypes like: DarkRP: A realistic-themed gametype where you can live a life, while simulateously throwing your own away. Prop Hunt: Don't like the way you look? Don't worry, you can turn into a cereal box if you'd like. Trouble in Terrorist Town: Because being a terrorist in real life is frowned upon. Zombie Survival: Let's be honest, a zombie apocalypse will NOT happen, right? Stop It, Slender!: Because a CPU-controlled Slender wasn't enough, now a player can hunt you down. SledBuild: THe XGames in the comfort of your room. Murder: WHODUNNIT?!?!? Sandbox: Place a headcrab because the stop spawning in Half-Life. Deathrun: get to point A to point B, while a player is going to great lengths to kill you. Jailbreak: Exactly like Cops and Robbers but not. Stranded: Sandbox but you get to stay on a tropical island. There are plenty more, don't worry. Before downloading, I would reccomend buying both Half-Life games, Counter Strike: Source, and Global Offensive. If you don't you will get :missing: (missing textures) that lag your game and look ugly. 9.5/10, buy it.

game-hours: 3408.7
review: This is amazing! You should totally get it! You can build and do anything to your heart's content, build a car, plane, house, or weapon. But it's not limited to building! You can also download gamemodes such as RP (Roleplay), TTT (Trouble in Terrorist Town), or prop hunt. Garry's Mod also has multiplayer, perfect for playing with your friends or just meeting new people. The game has infinite free DLC (Steam Workshop), you can download anything you want on there and fiddle around with it in-game. If you own any other game that runs on the Source Engine (Garry's Mod uses this engine, and that is why it has its name because it is a mod of Half-Life 2) or is made by Valve, you can mount the game's content into GMod and spawn them in-game. Wether it's attaching balloons to an airboat, smashing melons, to making fully automated houses, roleplaying, it's all possible on Garry's Mod. The possibilities are endless. 10/10, two thumbs up!

game-hours: 35.2
review: Garry's mod... I was a little late on this game, I heard about it from youtube, the videos they can make with it is just quite funny... Anyways, I only have about 20 hours of Garry's mod when I write this review... But let me tell you... That is PLENTY of time to tell you how much fun this "Game" is. I put game in quotations, because it's not really a game... It's a sandbox that let's you create your game, and much more. I love screwing around on this and making my own levels to face baddies, such as spawn on a TF2 map and then make it filled with Combine to shoot. You do need a game for this. The one that is recommeded is Team fortress 2. Since it's free to play. And that's another unique aspect of this game. It takes the games you have, if they are able to, and give you the maps and ragdolls and models to do as you wish. Garry's mod is basically ran with the same weapon system and health system as Half Life 2. As well as the same sounds. I can't really explain this game to you well, because words cannot be put on how awesome it is. Also, this game has workshop, and that means you can download models, and other things that'll expand what Garry's mod has to offer. This game can't really die, since people in the community are expanding it more and more. I recommend you get this game. worth every penny.

review: I bought Garry's Mod a few months ago and enjoyed it from the start. I know that some people would not play this because there is no ultimate purpose to this game but a purpose is not needed. This game allows you to do almost anything you want. You can put thrusters on cars, create a warzone for npc's (non playable characters), fill a city full of zombies and you can do this with friends as well. There is a workshop with thousands of addons to make your Garry's Mod better. There are even thousands of players online to play other modes with. there are heaps of online gamemodes that you can enjoy and these and the workshop addons are all free. I would recommend this game to anyone that enjoys fps games or players that have a huge imagination that want to let there minds run wild. Trust me, you will enjoy this game.

game-hours: 678.8
review: Garry's Mod is a game unlike any other, in a very good way. It does it's job better than any other undefined sandbox game in the market. It is very versatile, with a diverse community and gives out tons of creative incentive. It hits the spot when it comes to sandbox gaming, and with a capable engine (the Source Engine), it can run on many lower-end rigs as well. With the inclusion of the Steam Workshop with downloadable items, you can expand your game indefinitely with ease. It is a universe that you can have to yourself, or with your real-life friends and family on a local server, with your friends on Steam, with strangers on another server, or all at once! For ten dollars, you can receive an almost endless amount of entertainment. This game is worth more than the price-tag.

review: Garry's Mod is a physics sandbox. Unlike regular games there aren't any predefined aims or goals. You get the tools and leave you to play with them. You spawn objects and weld them together to create your own contraptions - whether that's a car, a rocket, a catapult or something that doesn't have a name yet - that's up to you.

game-hours: 34.2
review: Garry's Mod, is a sandbox game with many variations that you can add later. This game offers things such as "Trouble in Terrorist Town", were you find yourself either being innocent, a detective or a terrorist. As a terrorist you have to find yourself sly ways to kill innocents without others knowing. Detectives, find themselves using DNA scanners to see if they can find anything on corpses to lead them to the killer. Innocents are the most common and have to try not to get killed but can also kill. Also Prop hunt is another gamemode you can download. Either an object running around trying to find a hiding spot from the hunters trying to kill you... Aside from these two gamemodes there are many more. Although I have played this game a lot! It could take you hours to dowload the game, then get all the addons that servers requiere to play! Although onces getting into a lobby you like and talking to other players, you can get addicted easily. Unfourtuanatly I have to give this a 7 out of 10 for all of the time it takes to play the game.

review: I have no idea where to start. Garry's Mod is 'quirky', to say the least. With the endless choice of creative game modes which result in hours of fun and confusion as to where the last few hours have gone. Definitely a game to play with a group of friends. Unless you don't have any friends, in which case you can join a public server and make some! As well as the online game modes, it also features a sandbox mode in which you can build almost anything using the objects from practically every Source game (And then destroy your friends creations when they inevitably build something better than you). Definitely a game for a few hours of mindless fun. If you where looking for sanity, please look somewhere else.

It has quality server hosting, and WAY too many servers to even count. It has a great community. The gameplay is great, you can pose characters in anyway you like, you can even pose their FINGERS. The controls take some time to get used to, but once you get used to them you're always gonna be using them. This is hands down one of the BEST games I've played so far. I highly recommend it.

review: I bought this game after I bought Half-Life 2 (HL2). It was so fun I decided to get some more games made ont eh Source SDK Base engine. You know, games like HL2, Left 4 Dead... and Garry's Mod. I was skeptical about buying it, considering it has "Mod" in the name. I bought it, and its my most played game in my library. I passes Left 4 Dead, HL2, Terraria, etc. With many gametypes like: DarkRP: A realistic-themed gametype where you can live a life, while simulateously throwing your own away. Prop Hunt: Don't like the way you look? Don't worry, you can turn into a cereal box if you'd like. Trouble in Terrorist Town: Because being a terrorist in real life is frowned upon. Zombie Survival: Let's be honest, a zombie apocalypse will NOT happen, right? Stop It, Slender!: Because a CPU-controlled Slender wasn't enough, now a player can hunt you down. SledBuild: THe XGames in the comfort of your room. Murder: WHODUNNIT?!?!? Sandbox: Place a headcrab because the stop spawning in Half-Life. Deathrun: get to point A to point B, while a player is going to great lengths to kill you. Jailbreak: Exactly like Cops and Robbers but not. Stranded: Sandbox but you get to stay on a tropical island. There are plenty more, don't worry. Before downloading, I would reccomend buying both Half-Life games, Counter Strike: Source, and Global Offensive. If you don't you will get :missing: (missing textures) that lag your game and look ugly. 9.5/10, buy it.

game-hours: 811.7
review: Sandbox games were 2012s big thing, with indie world builder Minecraft achieving a level of support that bordered on the fanatical. It encouraged copycats from bedroom developers and big names alike, but one major update to an old school sandbox went unnoticed. Wed like to change that. Garrys Mod - the sandbox built on Half Life 2s game engine - has been rebuilt from scratch. First launched in 2006 the game turns Half Life 2 and Team Fortress 2, into a virtual construction kit. Originally based on the Valves Source engine, Garrys Mod 13 has its own compatible rendering engine - ridding the module of many bugs and enabling it to be used without Half Life 2. Sandbox games give users control over virtual worlds. In Minecrafts case, builders have blocks composed of different elements that enable them to craft landscapes and create buildings. In Garrys Mod, the elements are determined by the entities and maps extracted from HL2 and TF2. Play begins, in single player mode, with the selection of a map from either of those games. Hints are enabled automatically and a bubble will pop up urging you to press and hold Q on your keyboard. This opens a dialogue full of game elements, from none-player characters (NPCs) to weapons and furniture. The main attraction of Garrys Mod is the realistic - or unrealistic - simulation of physics in a virtual world When you place items in the maps, you have two special weapons to manipulate the world. The Physics Gun enables you to pick up and move items. Its a multipurpose tool that, when used with NPCs, allows you to position their limbs and bodies and then freeze them into place. The second special weapon is the Tool Gun, which is actually a number of different weapons all rolled into one. You can select what the Tool Gun does by selecting Q and choosing a function. This turns Garrys Mod from a dolls playhouse into a full construction set, with settings that enable you to create motors, winches, elastic ropes and more. The Tool Gun can also be used to finely tune the positioning of NPCs, with face, eye and finger posers. How you actually use Garrys Mod is up to you. Some build impossible structures, others create new games from the building blocks provided. A key, emerging use is virtual photography - screenshots capturing action that would be impossible to snap during the cut and thrust of a normal game. Like the Valve games that Garrys Mod was built on, it can be expanded. The Steam Workshop features additional tools and game modes, models and maps that you can download and use with Garrys Mod. Theres a multiplayer mode too - just like Half Life 2. The number of different game types in this mode is a testament to the inventiveness of the community. There are role-playing servers, zombie survival games, capture the flag, collaborative building servers, racing games... The list goes on and on. With Garrys Mod 13, you wont need Half Life 2 or Team Fortress 2 to play but you will need a lot of spare time. Its more like a hobby than a game.

review: Garry's Mod is a "game" where you can do.. well, just about anything. It's a sandbox! It mostly started out as a game where you could join a server with a few friends and screw around making contraptions and death machines, using props and objects from the source engine and using different tools to jury rig objects together. Creating working mechs, airplanes, cars, ferris wheel of death, whatever floats your boat. Garry's Mod has grown quite large since then and not only can you do that but there are dedicated servers for infinate game modes. If you're new to steam or pc gaming Garry's Mod is deffinetly a game you do not want to miss out on!

review: My Experience Playing Garry's Mod 1st minutes: Talking to a friend over Steam chat. Couldn't figure out how to get to the props menu. What's that arrow on the top right? Ahhhh, there we go. Thanks a lot friend. (Not) Gets balloon spawn gun. Bam bam bam bam.... Hmm, that's a lot of balloons. This shotgun should take care of that. POP POP POP POP.... Much better. Over 100 hours later: I have to say, I never thought that this game would be so much fun. When I first noticed that I had over 100 hours, I was like, "How?" I thought I would've had more hours on Arma II: OA on the DayZ mod. Apparently not. And for the price, this game is a steal. Especially if you get it on a special like Black Friday. This game has so many different mods and addons, someone who gets bored in 4.245 seconds would be content for 3.9807 years. If you're wondering if you should get it, just buy it. It's cheap, it can't go wrong, and it will you keep you interested for quite awhile. Even if you're just shooting endless zombies with customizable firearms (which is strangely addicting).

game-hours: 185.8
review: Really awesome game. The single player sandbox takes some learning when you start out but the Multiplayer has thousands of different game modes to choose from. From TTT to Prop hunt there are various different (minigames?) to choose from. There are over a thousand so that means if you don't like one game mode you can always go onto another. The first time download can take a while depending on the server and your internet but after that it should usually take just a few seconds. The number of creative tools and weapons are quite large and the physics engine is superb. One thing that is a downside is that if someone has a really bad ping on some less capable servers it will lag to hell. The number of weapons is a lot and that is usually a good thing when you are playing TTT. To sum it all up Gmod is an AWESOME game and should definately be bought

game-hours: 735.3

game-hours: 69.7
review: As a Director and Actor, I can certainly see the appeal of GMod. It's astounding how many tools are at your disposal, how many items you can spawn in, and the number of pills that change every game session. I mean, you can either make a game about Mario and Captain America questing to destroy the Thunderbird or play unique chase games in the Ghostbuster car or in a Tonka Truck. But is the pure randomness of this game the only thing it has going for it. Is it overrated and is it worth the ten dollar price tag. No. Maybe. and Maybe. Maybe I should explain. The randomness is certainly a major attractive point for players. With many user-created mods to mods from popular Valve games, you've got an unlimated amount of items, weapons, pills, and more to explore. I personally perfer the oddly catorted image of Mario as my skin, looking like a monkey with a Halloween costume. But my brothers perfer Ghost Rider and an Elderly man. Whatever your taste is, there is something for you. The items are very fun to use. Using a gun, you can move most items, rotating them or shooting them off. My personal favorite is a 10 story grave monument that shakes the ground when it lands. This is an unforgettable game. But as I look around Steam, I find people sinking 2000+ hours into this game. Is it fun? Hell yes. Is it good for movie making? Yeah. But two thousand hours is a lot, especially if you don't make movies. I feel like I've gotten a good amount of this game from 50 hours, but I play almost purely locally. Global servers are insane. The moderators often resort to limiting items to avoid Internet hell for those on board Nothing more scary than an insane player with a rocket launcher online. It is a good, "game," but I hear people put this high on their top games of all time. My brothers and I have created games from the multiple maps present and they definatly are fun but nothing I haven't experienced on other games. In short, this game is slightly overrated. Not a bad game, at all, just a quirky game, which some people are into that. The ten dollar price tag is a concern for me. I feel this game should be no more than five dollars, since it is esentially a toolbox. Luckily, I was able to trade for my copy and I feel that is the way to go if you are feeling like picking this up. OVERALL: 7/10. This game is defiently a game to at least try with friends once. Even without mentioning the fantastic, Trouble in Terrorist Town, this game has a lot going for it. I would not consider it a classic but it recieves it's own identity when the user created models and imagination shines through. The graphics range from, Ouija-bad, to, Intersteller-good, (cheers if you know exactly what I mean,), the tools are in depth, local multiplayer is a blast when globally, it is a nightmare. The tool system is deep and I highly recommend those going into animation to at least have this in your library.

I've moderated servers and I've been bound to this game ever since. The only boundaries, are those you set yourself.

game-hours: 283.5
review: Garry's mod... Yep. Garry's Mod. This game is actually quite underestimated to the eyes of an outsider, but truthfully, there are so many gamemodes, all evoking the inguenity and creativty that are lying dormant in us. Garry's Mod actually requires ALOT of creativity fo a person to experience the fun in this game. I'm not saying this game is really complex, I'm just saying that this game is superb in getting a person to use one's imagination, which is really substantial especially for an Indie game. Sure, graphics and features are sometimes meh, but hey, main point is that you're having fun. I doubt a person would go in and have fun based on just graphics. This game has several gamemodes, for those who enjoy experimenting with mods, addons, and dlc's, theres the "sandbox" and "workshop" for you to tinker around in to your liking. The physics in this game are also fabulous. One of the most realistic physics features in any game I've seen (except for freezing items in midair, but shhhh). For those who enjoy FPS's, theres main gamemodes that include shooting and interactive PVP. If you're the "Sherlock Holmes, detective," sort of guy, then there's Gmod Murder and TTT (trouble in Terrorist Town) which invoke many aspects of finding out who the "killer/traitor" is. Overall, I'd rate this game like a 9/10. Few things could be changed, but overall, it was a time well spent. Wasted months, No regrets. I'm happy.

game-hours: 1815.1
review: This game is by far the most addicting and exciting that I've found. From the incredible features of sandbox to the complex and intriguing gamemodes like DarkRP, TTT, Murder, and others, the opportunities that this game allows you to choose from are inumerable. The price is ridiculously cheap compared to others, and drops to extreme lows during sales such as $2.50. Even if this game were to be priced at $30, it would still be more than worth it as it allows you to choose from many other different kinds of gamemodes. Not satisfied with any of the current gamemodes? Feel free to create your own with a little bit of prior knowledge and experience, as well as the helpful community built around the game. I honestly can't think of many cons to this game besides infrequent bugs that are eventually patched by developers. Would definitely reccomend this game to anyone who would listen.

game-hours: 725.4
review: Garry's Mod... there is no explaining what this is or what can be done with it, if you can imagine it... then you can possibly do it with this game! This is one of the best games on Steam as it is Sandbox and you can pretty much do what you like. Therefore it has many positvies with little to no negatives! Positives: - Sandbox - Steam Workshop (Add someones, create one, do what you like with it, enjoy) - Many different multiplayer game modes - Server List is amazing - Voice Chat works like a boss - Downloading server items works like a boss I can't really think of many negatives except: Negatives: - Game Updates temporarily break servers - Adding too many Steam Workshop items can cause the game to crash - Some of the kill x NPC achievements etc have been reported not to work for some users. Overall, in my opinion, if you can find the right server, the right group of friends and the right Workshop items... you can have endless fun in this game with little to no glitches, bugs or trouble. It's relatively cheap and always on sale, so if you don't have it, I'd highly recommend it. Overall, I'd rate this 5/5 <3!

review: i played 3 things so far with my few hours experience TTT (Trouble In Terrorest Town) is a really great minigame that is at the start of the game you collect guns/grenades and you get either 15-30 seconds to prepare the innocent needs to find the traitor/traitors and kill them and you win if you kill them detective is pretty much the same thing traitor needs to kill the innocent and detectives to win Prop Hunt has the same objective as hide and seek (irl) hunters need to hunt props and props need to hide and blend in with the map you are in but beware when you are a hunter every bullet you shoot counts as some of your hp (health points) Sand Box is your own little world you can spawn items,drive cars,Kill Zombies And even invite your friends to come and play I highly recommend this game it was worth my money to get and who ever reads this i hope you enjoy it also :)

review: Garry's mod is a great time killer if you know what I mean. You can have a good time playing alone, with friends or just going multiplayer with other people. It's a sandbox game that allows you to build, create, film, posing or just have a good time messing around with guns and npcs. Gmod has a great workshop, there you will find lots of stuff that will keep your attention and woun't get you bored. By the way if you do get bored playing sandbox there are a lot more gamemodes, like Trouble in Terrorist Town, Prop hunt, Hide and Seek, Zombie survival, Stop it Slender and many more... Note: I would highly recommend to buy Counter-Strike: Source with Garry's mod since workshop uses a lot of CS:S content. You may also want to have Half-life 2 series to get even better experience. Gmod can use other content from Source engine games like Counter Strike Global Offensive, Team Fortress 2, Portal 2, Left for Dead 2 and more... To sum up I believe that this game is a great game to spend time alone or with friends, you will newer get bored with it and have a great time.

game-hours: 133.6
review: Decent. Garry's Mod is one of the most popular games in recent history...or should I say, mod? Basically, it's a sandbox mod that has mods itself. In other words, GMod is essentially modception. You can build things of your own, manipulate ragdolls of characters from Source games (and anything else, with mods), and make videos and screenshots with them. You can join servers that use these mods and have fun with your friends- The possibilities are endless. ...However, I think the Source engine itself is GMod's downfall; It's bad enough the engine itself is already unoptimized as is, but when you have physics-intense things happening everywhere around you, your CPU isn't going to have a very fun time. Regardless, this is a fun game, and I suggest you pick it up. Also buy CS:S with it; It provides the most content for the game, and it's needed for Trouble in Terrorist Town.

review: Having over 200+ hours on Gmod, I think I can write a truth-full review: This game is really fun, you can do just about anything! In single player (based on the things you add to Gmod from the workshop) you can: Shoot your guns like the 9mm pistol, a 6 shot revolver, a triggered bomb/laser mine bomb, a gravity gun, and then your tools you use to build, the tool gun, and the laser mover thingy But you can add more weapons like a AK-47, C4, Colt 44, and other great guns! On multiplayer you can get mods ( duh, of corse :P ) Like Prop hunt (prop hunt is a game where you can be whatever prop you want, and you have to try to hide from the hunters, the hunters try to find all the props before time runs out!) Murder (Murder is a mod where you have bystanders, and 1 bystander will have a secret weapon, then there is a murder, the murders role is to kill every one without getting shot, by the bystander with his secret weapon!) Hide & Seek (Hide & Seek is a mod where they are hiders and seekers, the hiders hide from the seekers seeking :P the seekers role is to find all the hiders before time runs out!) And other great mods, but those are the ones I play often! 415612435452435245/5 - IGN Now please thumbs this review up it took a long time to type :D

review: Summary: Garry's Mod is a physics sandbox. Unlike regular games there aren't any predefined aims or goals. We give you the tools and leave you to play. You spawn objects and weld them together to create your own contraptions - whether that's a car, a rocket, a catapult or something that doesn't have a name yet - that's up to you. If you're not too great at construction - don't worry! You can place a variety of characters in silly positions. ______________________________________________________________________________ My Review. I have never been a fan of sandbox games, but my god this is fantastic. There is so much to do in this game, including one heck of a multiplayer, that just make this game so good. Valve never fail to disappoint, and Garry's Mod shows just how good Valve is. May not be up there with Half-Life and the like, but still an easy 10/10. Again, another 10/10.

game-hours: 69.7
review: As a Director and Actor, I can certainly see the appeal of GMod. It's astounding how many tools are at your disposal, how many items you can spawn in, and the number of pills that change every game session. I mean, you can either make a game about Mario and Captain America questing to destroy the Thunderbird or play unique chase games in the Ghostbuster car or in a Tonka Truck. But is the pure randomness of this game the only thing it has going for it. Is it overrated and is it worth the ten dollar price tag. No. Maybe. and Maybe. Maybe I should explain. The randomness is certainly a major attractive point for players. With many user-created mods to mods from popular Valve games, you've got an unlimated amount of items, weapons, pills, and more to explore. I personally perfer the oddly catorted image of Mario as my skin, looking like a monkey with a Halloween costume. But my brothers perfer Ghost Rider and an Elderly man. Whatever your taste is, there is something for you. The items are very fun to use. Using a gun, you can move most items, rotating them or shooting them off. My personal favorite is a 10 story grave monument that shakes the ground when it lands. This is an unforgettable game. But as I look around Steam, I find people sinking 2000+ hours into this game. Is it fun? Hell yes. Is it good for movie making? Yeah. But two thousand hours is a lot, especially if you don't make movies. I feel like I've gotten a good amount of this game from 50 hours, but I play almost purely locally. Global servers are insane. The moderators often resort to limiting items to avoid Internet hell for those on board Nothing more scary than an insane player with a rocket launcher online. It is a good, "game," but I hear people put this high on their top games of all time. My brothers and I have created games from the multiple maps present and they definatly are fun but nothing I haven't experienced on other games. In short, this game is slightly overrated. Not a bad game, at all, just a quirky game, which some people are into that. The ten dollar price tag is a concern for me. I feel this game should be no more than five dollars, since it is esentially a toolbox. Luckily, I was able to trade for my copy and I feel that is the way to go if you are feeling like picking this up. OVERALL: 7/10. This game is defiently a game to at least try with friends once. Even without mentioning the fantastic, Trouble in Terrorist Town, this game has a lot going for it. I would not consider it a classic but it recieves it's own identity when the user created models and imagination shines through. The graphics range from, Ouija-bad, to, Intersteller-good, (cheers if you know exactly what I mean,), the tools are in depth, local multiplayer is a blast when globally, it is a nightmare. The tool system is deep and I highly recommend those going into animation to at least have this in your library.

game-hours: 142.8
review: [9/10] - This game is hard to describe using words. In short it's a physics sandbox that lets you manipulate content from any of your other source engine games. From building bases, to building a car, to posing props, to building weapons, to making remote controlled vehicles, to..... It's literally endless entertainment from beginning to end, but with a catch. At first glance, it might not seem so, but if you take the time to try new things and be creative there is nothing you can't do with this game. Theres this handy thing called the toolbox that lets you spawn entities, props, save games, maps, weapons and so much more from other developers and best of all, all while playing in game. With full multiplayer support, if your a creative junkie like me, you must try this game.

review: Fun game, funny game, do whatever you want! Make your own maps, etc. Share with your friends! 9/10.
game-hours: 625.7
review: Do you love sandbox games, if so trust me your going to love this game. This game does require a Source game to play. So to start off your new sandbox adventure start off with the free Source game TeamFortress 2. The more Source games you own the more powerful your game becomes, because with more sources of games the more items there are to use. Now we all know there are millions of add-ons for this game thanks to the community, and of course not all of them are going to work. Dont let that bring you down, its not that hard to learn LUA (the coding launguage for most add-ons in Garry's mod.) Games I reccomend having for this game: Half-life 2, Half-life 2: episode 1, Half-life 2: episode 2, Counter strike: source, Team Fortress 2, Left 4 dead, Left 4 dead 2. Keep in mind you need to have them installed for them to work on Garrys' mod. Now this game does take time to learn how to use your tools, and phys gun (the main tool for prop, ragdoll, or really anything) manipulation. If needed go check out some tutorials online. Once you understand the basics the limits are up to you. Using anything, (from the Source games you have installed to your pc), to create anything you desire. This game is incrediable, easy to make servers allow you and your friends to play. Using the Community made add-ons bring in things that are not already in the game to your hands, well your in-game hands. Create things and share them with the Community, your options are only limited to your imagination. Using the Source engine, Garry's mod is one of the best sandbox games, in my personal opinion. Now grab your chair, turn off your alarm clock, call in sick for work, make sure you mouse has batteries, just in case grab a spare, put your phone on silent, now pre... wait grab some drinks and food. NOW, press buy, then install and click play........ Your new sandbox adventure has just started.

game-hours: 35.2
review: Garry's mod... I was a little late on this game, I heard about it from youtube, the videos they can make with it is just quite funny... Anyways, I only have about 20 hours of Garry's mod when I write this review... But let me tell you... That is PLENTY of time to tell you how much fun this "Game" is. I put game in quotations, because it's not really a game... It's a sandbox that let's you create your game, and much more. I love screwing around on this and making my own levels to face baddies, such as spawn on a TF2 map and then make it filled with Combine to shoot. You do need a game for this. The one that is recommeded is Team fortress 2. Since it's free to play. And that's another unique aspect of this game. It takes the games you have, if they are able to, and give you the maps and ragdolls and models to do as you wish. Garry's mod is basically ran with the same weapon system and health system as Half Life 2. As well as the same sounds. I can't really explain this game to you well, because words cannot be put on how awesome it is. Also, this game has workshop, and that means you can download models, and other things that'll expand what Garry's mod has to offer. This game can't really die, since people in the community are expanding it more and more. I recommend you get this game. worth every penny.

game-hours: 34.2
review: Garry's Mod, is a sandbox game with many variations that you can add later. This game offers things such as "Trouble in Terrorist Town", were you find yourself either being innocent, a detective or a terrorist. As a terrorist you have to find yourself sly ways to kill innocents without others knowing. Detectives, find themselves using DNA scanners to see if they can find anything on corpses to lead them to the killer. Innocents are the most common and have to try not to get killed but can also kill. Also Prop hunt is another gamemode you can download. Either an object running around trying to find a hiding spot from the hunters trying to kill you... Aside from these two gamemodes there are many more. Although I have played this game a lot! It could take you hours to dowload the game, then get all the addons that servers requiere to play! Although onces getting into a lobby you like and talking to other players, you can get addicted easily. Unfourtuanatly I have to give this a 7 out of 10 for all of the time it takes to play the game.

game-hours: 128.1
review: Having over 200+ hours on Gmod, I think I can write a truth-full review: This game is really fun, you can do just about anything! In single player (based on the things you add to Gmod from the workshop) you can: Shoot your guns like the 9mm pistol, a 6 shot revolver, a triggered bomb/laser mine bomb, a gravity gun, and then your tools you use to build, the tool gun, and the laser mover thingy But you can add more weapons like a AK-47, C4, Colt 44, and other great guns! On multiplayer you can get mods ( duh, of corse :P ) Like Prop hunt (prop hunt is a game where you can be whatever prop you want, and you have to try to hide from the hunters, the hunters try to find all the props before time runs out!) Murder (Murder is a mod where you have bystanders, and 1 bystander will have a secret weapon, then there is a murder, the murders role is to kill every one without getting shot, by the bystander with his secret weapon!) Hide & Seek (Hide & Seek is a mod where they are hiders and seekers, the hiders hide from the seekers seeking :P the seekers role is to find all the hiders before time runs out!) And other great mods, but those are the ones I play often! 415612435452435245/5 - IGN Now please thumbs this review up it took a long time to type :D

review: Garry's Mod, a game where you can let your imagination run free, and acquire many, many add-ons to make your time there all the more enjoyable. There is seemingly a gamemode for everybody to enjoy, (The gamemodes I usually play are Sandbox, DarkRP, Prop Hunt and TTT) and plenty of servers to keep playing that might have their own custom group of add-ons, allowing you to experiment with new items, that might have you say "Hey, that would be AWESOME to have in my singleplayer!" and then you try it out, and combine it with your other items to have one big collection of some of your favourite game characters, anime characters, weapons, vehicles, NPC's and tons of other cool stuff. In conclusion, all this workshop content that I have been going on about, is what keeps Garry's Mod fresh, new, and one of my favourite games, that I strongly recommend and hope that you give it a try.

game-hours: 257.6
review: Garry's Mod is a must buy. Featuring source (the engine that runs all of valve's games) is a physics based engine which adds alot of realism to the game. Garry's Mod (or Gmod) is based off Half-life 2 and Counter Strike Source and is basically just a sandbox version of it. There is so much to do no wonder I have already play 200+ hours into the game and I'm glad I have. You can dive into the vast multiplayer world of gmod (which is a big part of the game) and experiance game modes like Trouble in terrorist town, which players must find who the traitor is and kill him whilst the traitor(s) have to kill the innocent. Or prop hunt, which players must disguise as a prop to avoid being killed by a hunter who must hunt them down. I would go through the rest like DarkRp, murder, hide and seek or Stop it Slender but that would take up the whole review box and you probably don't want to read all that. If you are getting bored just install new addons form the steam workshop or make your own. To conclude this long review, this game is a fun enjoyable sandbox game which offers so much to do. 10/10. Well done Garry Newman! Seriously you should get it, it's super cheap with how much content it comes with, it's enormous how much this community has grown over the years. Very happy with my purchase.

review: My Experience Playing Garry's Mod 1st minutes: Talking to a friend over Steam chat. Couldn't figure out how to get to the props menu. What's that arrow on the top right? Ahhhh, there we go. Thanks a lot friend. (Not) Gets balloon spawn gun. Bam bam bam bam.... Hmm, that's a lot of balloons. This shotgun should take care of that. POP POP POP POP.... Much better. Over 100 hours later: I have to say, I never thought that this game would be so much fun. When I first noticed that I had over 100 hours, I was like, "How?" I thought I would've had more hours on Arma II: OA on the DayZ mod. Apparently not. And for the price, this game is a steal. Especially if you get it on a special like Black Friday. This game has so many different mods and addons, someone who gets bored in 4.245 seconds would be content for 3.9807 years. If you're wondering if you should get it, just buy it. It's cheap, it can't go wrong, and it will you keep you interested for quite awhile. Even if you're just shooting endless zombies with customizable firearms (which is strangely addicting).

review: This game is worth the little money it costs. When I first got the game I purely bought it for the creative aspect of the game. I bought it with a few friends thinking that I would play a few hours of it and thought the few dollars I spent were well used. However, after a few weeks I got bored with creating and moved on to other games. It was actually till another friend told me about this cool new alien game mode for Garrys Mod called Morbus that I got back on. From that point on I was hooked. There are very few games that I have played as long as this one and I think it can be credited to the replay-ability and versatility of this game and the game modes its players create. TTT, Murder, Morbus and many other game modes offer hours and hours of fun and since this game is normally always on sale on steam I would recommend it to anyone with a few dollars to spare.

game-hours: 318.2
review: I went to visit the Garry's Mod's offices back in October 2013, I wished to look into career opportunities at Facepunch studios and perhaps meet Mr Newman for myself. I was personally greeted by what appeared to be a Gorilla in an adidas tracksuit working the receptionist desk. As I approached the specimen, it reached it's large furry mitt towards me and grasped my hand while grunting - fracturing 2 or 3 bones in grabbers. The monstrous being began to beat it's chest and grunt - which I later interpreted was Primate for "Mr Newman will be down shortly." I sat there in the waiting room and finally met Mr Newman, he had a large gold medallion (that I later learnt was bronze with gold plating) that had the words BAD MUTHAA inscribed. We got into the elevator and made smalltalk. As we were between the 1st and 2nd floor, Mr Newman turned to me and started producing a high pitched screech "EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE". I was threatened to say the least and tried to back away towards the wall of the elevator. He turned to me whilst still screeching "EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE" and began raining blows on my stirnum, it felt like minutes were going by but I was paralysed with fear as he continued to screech and pummel my now bloody and beating torso. "EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE" *THUMP* "EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE" *THUMP* "EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE" *CRACK* "EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE" After Mr Newman had shattered my rib cage I felt my lungs filling with blood and I lost consciousness. I awoke to find myself in the basement of the building ductaped to a filthy, piss and blood stained hospital bed. As my eyes adjusted to the artificial lighting I met eyes with Mr Newman who was wearing nothing but a diaper and a childs size pink t-shirt with the words "Daddy's Princess" wrote in glitter across the front. We continued this Mexican stand off, me bloodied, broken and weeping with Mr Newman appearing visibly aroused. I had a great deal of trouble breaking his piercing gaze but my eyes were drawn to his malformed, pasty, hairless body. If I wasn't in such pain perhaps I'd have imagined a shaven cerebral palsy suffering Orangutan stood staring me down. He produced a large syringe filled with a suspicious fizzing green liquid that he injected directly into my temple. After 30 seconds of unimaginable pain and terror I once more lost consciousness and blacked out. I awoke to find myself unharmed, with not even a single scar nor bruise on a bench facing the Face Punch studios main entrance. Looking down at myself, I doubted my own sanity as I had nary a hair out of place. The only recompence I had was that I had in my hands an authorized application form that they had accepted my application to become a software developer with the company which shockingly to me, was entirely in my hand writing. I have now been working with Facepunch studios for 2 years now and would happily recommend anyone curious to pay us a visit, on Friday's at precisely 1pm Mr Newman will grease himself up in chip batter and gallop around the offices after employees on all fours. Those who he catches he drags to his office in rusted chains, those luckily enough to escape get to go home early.

game-hours: 2.5
review: Garry's Mod (GM) is a virtual world developed by Linden Lab launched on June 23, 2003, and is accessible on the Internet. A free client program called the Viewer enables its users, called Residents, to interact with each other through avatars. Residents can explore, meet other residents, socialize, participate in individual and group activities, and create and trade virtual property and services with one another, or travel throughout the world (which residents refer to as "the grid"). Garry's Mod is for people aged 18 and over.

review: Garry's mod is a Half-Life 2 mod that was released in 2006 and was later given it's own game. Garry's Mod has pratctically endless things to do. Pose ragdolls, roleplay with other players, play Trouble in Terrorist Town with friends or other players, and thousands of other things tyo do. Don't like one mods? Go play another! Don't like any of the maps? Go and download more off of the Steam workshop! Don't like the default graphics? Go download some modifications to make the game look better! Pros+ Runs off of the source engine, so you can run it on a potato or a toaster Nearly infinite addons giving you more possibilities in game Large, and still growing community with stunning screenshots and artwork Small download Difficult to get bored of Cons- Long loading times, even with all of the servers' addons Dependant on textures from other games (Counter-Strike: Source, CS:GO, HL2, Ep1, Ep2, DOD:S, etc.) Squeakers like crazy Butthurt multiplayer admins Lazy developer The game in my opinion deserves a 9/10 on a good day, but most days I just want to kill everybody in the world after I play this game.

Being bystander or murderer or detective is randomly. If you be the murderer you should kill everybody before you get black smokes around you. The most exciting mode is "Sandbox" for me. Its about your imagination power, you can create your own map, weapons, npcs or something else, can code Lua files or change their properties and it supports you with cool items on Workshop. You can pose faces and npcs, also invent your own flying-house. As i said its about your imagination power, you are free to do everything. There is only rule is physics, also you can break them all. So just check it out, i mean the sandbox mode. Well thats all guys, I'll hope you see you in another review. -The Quick Brown Fox.

game-hours: 519.8
review: Has to be one of the best games I've ever played on Steam. When they say anything is possible they aren't kidding. The secret to REALLY enjoying the game would be to find a solid-quality server, meet some friends, and just find different ways of having fun! Trust me when I say there are plenty. The very few negative qualities would be a bit of an overwhelming object-spawn-options menu, but you get used to that quickly. The main other negative that you will probably notice if you spend a bit of time in multiplayer is that in a lot of servers the community can be kind of crap which is why I say it's very important you take a bit of time finding a quality server to spend your time on! I personally reccomend DarkRP, Clockwork Half-Life RP, TTT, and Murder! Some of the more popular game modes anyways, and I enjoy them. Overall I'd say a 10/10 game! Just steer clear of  servers, familiarize yourself with the way the game works, and you'll be laughing your  off in no time!

game-hours: 714.1
review: This is a mod created in 2007 for Half Life 2. At the beginning you need the game for play it, but then it becomes standalone. There are lots of gamemodes, but i put only the most interesting that I've played: - TTT (Trouble in Terrorist Town) = One of the most played gamemodes of this game. There are 3 teams: innocent, traitors and detectives. Innocent must kill traitors, but they must do it with concrete proofs, without kill other innocents or they do RDM (Random Deathmatch).Traitors must kill all innocents and detectives with special items and strategy without being detected, otherwise they can fail. In particular the traitors must focus on Detectives, whos can discover them easily. Detectives must discover Traitors with special items and the DNA Scanner without killing innocents, but they can shoot them for warn and give commands. - Sandbox = Main gamemode of the game. Its mainly made for posing ragdolls and other stuff, but u can do lots of other things like fighting NPC's with weird and addon weapons, Deathmatch with friends, etc. This gamemode uses the addons of the workshop. - Deathrun = The name tells all. There are 2 teams: Runners, whos must run at the end of the course and choose the punishment of deaths with a minigame. Deaths must kill all runners with traps settled on the course, avoiding them to come to the end of the line. - Prop Hunt = There are 2 teams. Props, whos must hide from other team, disguising them as props (entities from a videogame). Hunters, whos must kill all props shooting them, BUT they must save bullets, because any wasted bullet costs in health. This is what I can tell you. Hope you will like this game.

review: This game has given me hundreds of hours of entertainment and I'd reccomend it to everyone. This game has a little bit for everyone, from people who want to build something wonderful to people who simply want  around in sandbox mode. The sandbox, however, isn't the best part. The true greatness of this game lies in its' ability to be modded, and because of the flexibility of the engine there are thousands of different and unique mods, gamemodes, and addons for this game. This game is cheap and surely give anyone hours of entertainment, which is more than enough justification for anyone to buy this.

game-hours: 714.1
review: This is a mod created in 2007 for Half Life 2. At the beginning you need the game for play it, but then it becomes standalone. There are lots of gamemodes, but i put only the most interesting that I've played: - TTT (Trouble in Terrorist Town) = One of the most played gamemodes of this game. There are 3 teams: innocent, traitors and detectives. Innocent must kill traitors, but they must do it with concrete proofs, without kill other innocents or they do RDM (Random Deathmatch).Traitors must kill all innocents and detectives with special items and strategy without being detected, otherwise they can fail. In particular the traitors must focus on Detectives, whos can discover them easily. Detectives must discover Traitors with special items and the DNA Scanner without killing innocents, but they can shoot them for warn and give commands. - Sandbox = Main gamemode of the game. Its mainly made for posing ragdolls and other stuff, but u can do lots of other things like fighting NPC's with weird and addon weapons, Deathmatch with friends, etc. This gamemode uses the addons of the workshop. - Deathrun = The name tells all. There are 2 teams: Runners, whos must run at the end of the course and choose the punishment of deaths with a minigame. Deaths must kill all runners with traps settled on the course, avoiding them to come to the end of the line. - Prop Hunt = There are 2 teams. Props, whos must hide from other team, disguising them as props (entities from a videogame). Hunters, whos must kill all props shooting them, BUT they must save bullets, because any wasted bullet costs in health. This is what I can tell you. Hope you will like this game.

review: Hello today i will be discussing this amazing game and why i have played over 200 hours on it and if it is worth your money if you are looking to buy it. If you play some multiplayer with your friends i would reccomend that u check out one of the amazing gamemodes called Trouble in Terrorist Town it might sound a bit weird but man... it is a whole bunch of fun. How it works is there are innocents and traitors the trators have a traitor shop where they can buy weapons with there credits to kill the innocents. For traitors to win they will have to kill all the innocents ( Most of the people are innocents ) and the innocents will win if they kill all the traitors. You can find weapons lying around randomly spawned. Another great gamemode is Murder, in Murder u have 1 Murderer and the rest are Bystanders some of the bystanders spawn with a gun which is one shot kill but once u have shot 1 bullet out of the gun u have to reload it. The murderer has a knife which is an instant kill, the murderer can also throw thee knife and he/she has a sprint boost. This is an amazing game that u should definitely pick up so we can play some of these gamemodes together or i could teach u some tips and tricks on how to be better at these gamemodes. But be warned when u purchase Gmod there will be errors. To fix this u can buy CSS which will download the patches for the errors and if u dont have CSS there is a bundle on steam for Gmod and CSS which will reduce the cost for them both. Thanks for reading my review and i hope to see you soon.

game-hours: 2635.2
review: Pro's: Amazing game for expressing your imagination in many ways. So many ways to build and create things that you CAN'T do in any other game. Of course, building isn't fun forever. That's why you have tens of thousands of mods to keep you entertained for a long time. And if you can stand the masses of immature pre-teens, there's always multiplayer. Con's: Bad playerbase. Looking for some mature, non-mingy fun? Nope. Unless you're really lucky and can find a decent community to stick with, you're out of luck. The game also requires additional content, however that's not necessarily a con'. Review: This was actually the first game I bought on steam (with Counter Strike) and I used to love it. The majority of my play time (2,500+ hours) was all done within about the first two, three years I had the game. The gamemodes were amazing, the communities were mostly awesome. I could literally just waste an entire day playing PERP or HL2RP. Eventually, however, the people started to change. With the game's increasing popularity, the quality of the game quickly deteriated for me. Soon, TTT Servers took over and pretty much every relaxed gamemode (Dark RP for example) became a Team Deathmatch. I personally enjoyed roleplaying quite a bit, and I stuck with that for a while. Even that eventually started becoming more about making a large community rather than a good one. So, while I believe this game has become a waste of money, I've also spent a lot of time in it and I can see where I might get bored. So, if this looks interesting to you, buy it. It's still an amazing game, even if you're a cynical, overly critical thinker such as myself <3

game-hours: 906.0
review: Uh Not too sure what to write here so heres a recipe for Pancakes instead Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour 3 tablespoons sugar 1 tablespoon baking powder 1/4 teaspoon salt 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg 2 large eggs, at room temperature 1 1/4 cups milk, at room temperature 1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more as needed Now to make it 1. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg. 2. In another bowl, beat the eggs and then whisk in the milk and vanilla. 3. Melt the butter in a large cast iron skillet or griddle over medium heat. 4. Whisk the butter into the milk mixture. Add the wet ingredients to the flour mixture, and whisk until a thick batter is just formed 5. Keeping the skillet at medium heat, ladle about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet, to make a pancake. Make 1 or 2 more pancakes, taking care to keep them evenly spaced apart. Cook, until bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, and the undersides are golden brown, about 2 minutes. Flip with a spatula and cook about 1 minute more on the second side. Serve immediately or transfer to a platter and cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining batter, adding more butter to the skillet as needed. 6. Procedure for adding fruit to pancakes: Once the bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, scatter the surface with sliced or diced fruit, or chocolate chips, nuts, etc. Flip with a spatula and cook for 1 minute more, being careful not to burn toppings.

review: Hello today i will be discussing this amazing game and why i have played over 200 hours on it and if it is worth your money if you are looking to buy it. This is an amazing game which is so much fun when u play with your friends or just mess around with the sandbox on simulator. If you play some multiplayer with your friends i would reccomend that u check out one of the amazing gamemodes called Trouble in Terrorist Town it might sound a bit weird but man... it is a whole bunch of fun. How it works is there are innocents and traitors the trators have a traitor shop where they can buy weapons with there credits to kill the innocents. For traitors to win they will have to kill all the innocents ( Most of the people are innocents ) and the innocents will win if they kill all the traitors. You can find weapons lying around randomly spawned. Another great gamemode is Murder, in Murder u have 1 Murderer and the rest are Bystanders some of the bystanders spawn with a gun which is one shot kill but once u have shot 1 bullet out of the gun u have to reload it. The murderer has a knife which is an instant kill, the murderer can also throw thee knife and he/she has a sprint boost. This is an amazing game that u should definitely pick up so we can play some of these gamemodes together or i could teach u some tips and tricks on how to be better at these gamemodes. But be warned when u purchase Gmod there will be errors. To fix this u can buy CSS which will download the patches for the errors and if u dont have CSS there is a bundle on steam for Gmod and CSS which will reduce the cost for them both. Thanks for reading my review and i hope to see you soon.

review: Has to be one of the best games I've ever played on Steam. When they say anything is possible they aren't kidding. The secret to REALLY enjoying the game would be to find a solid-quality server, meet some friends, and just find different ways of having fun! Trust me when I say there are plenty. The very few negative qualities would be a bit of an overwhelming object-spawn-options menu, but you get used to that quickly. The main other negative that you will probably notice if you spend a bit of time in multiplayer is that in a lot of servers the community can be kind of crap which is why I say it's very important you take a bit of time finding a quality server to spend your time on! I personally reccomend DarkRP, Clockwork Half-Life RP, TTT, and Murder! Some of the more popular game modes anyways, and I enjoy them. Overall I'd say a 10/10 game! Just steer clear of  servers, familiarize yourself with the way the game works, and you'll be laughing your  off in no time!

game-hours: 4453.8
review: Now this is a great game! It contains many different gamemodes, from Sandbox to Hide n' Seek. Today, I'm going to be talking about Trouble in Terriorist Town, DarkRP, Sandbox, Deathrun, Parkour, Prophunt and Murder. ```````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````` Trouble in Terriorist Town: There are (usually) 3 roles. Traitor, Innocent and Detective. The aim of the game is simple: the Traitors are trying to kill the innocents, the Innocents are trying to kill the Traitors, and the Detectives have a special tool called the 'DNA Scanner' which they can use to collect dna off dead bodies. To accomplish this goal, traitors must work together, and communicate well (by holding down leftshift to speak to all traitors). Not only that, traitors and detectives can buy special equipment with 'points' by clicking 'c'. "I'm innocent!! Don't kill me" "Ok, I won't" (Stabs him with a knife) ```````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````` DarkRP (Dark Roleplay): You start off as a citizen. You change jobs (F4) and act like you would if you were actually that person in real life. A few examples of what you could be: Gun Dealer's who sell guns, Mafia who terrorize for a living, Police units that control crime, or just your everyday hobo. Once you get to know this gamemode it's hard to stop playing it. Although there are many rules, it's easy to remember them. "Hey you want to buy some drugs?" "Yeah!" "Here is some coke." (Consumes all the coke.) "Uhh I...Feel....Bad...." (Dies of overdose) ```````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````` Sandbox: This is a gamemode where you can do anything. You can play on any map you've previously downloaded and just explore, or you could go on a default map and create the biggest and laggiest machine you can possibly build!!!!!! "Hey you want to build something?" "Sure" (Blows him up with RPG) ```````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````` Deathrun: There are 'Deaths' and 'Runners'. The Deaths are trying to kill the Runners by activating traps. The Runners are trying to kill the Deaths by evading the traps and getting to the end. Pretty simple, yet super fun! "Don't worry, the trap's been activated" "Sure...." (Everyone runs past but 1 person) "See! It's been activated" (He runs over the trap) (Death activates trap) "Seeya mate!" ```````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````` Parkour: Although not played often, I enjoy playing this gamemode as you can just muck around and try challanges to survive and stuff! You should really try it! "Parkour time!!!" (Jumps off 500m high building) (Roles on the ground) "Easy!!" ```````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````` Prophunt: There are two teams: Props and Hunters. The Props can transform into (certain) props and try to survive for the full time limit. The Hunters are trying to kill you although, if they hit a prop that isn't a player, they lose their health. Extremely addicting gamemode that is one of the most popular. "Oh gawd the hunter is right here!" (Hunter shoots grenade) (Kills prop + himself) "Yes!!! I got you!!!" "Well, you were the last hunter :P" ```````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````` Murder: There is 1 guy with a knife, 1 guy with a gun, and the rest are just normal people. The murderer is trying to kill everyone, and the only way to kill him is to shoot him. There is 'loot' that everyone can pick up. The murderer uses the loot to transform into dead people, the others use it to make more guns (you need 5 loot). "Oh crap he has the knife!!!!" "Oh no he can run super fast!!!" (Murderer knifes them both.) "I win mofo!!!" (Murderer gets shot)

game-hours: 671.2
review: A very fun game with and without mods, easily one of the better sandbox games out there. There's a huge range of options for different people, from building enthusiasts to machinima makers. The experience gets better when mods are enabled, which adds even more variety. Multiplayer is also great, as you get to interact with fellow players and make friends. The price of the game isn't bad either, costing only $9.99, with prices as low as $2.49 during sales. However, there are some faults in the game, mainly LUA errors, but they're not too major. The selection of maps in the vanilla game is very bland as well. Gripes aside, I highly recommend Garry's Mod, it's worth every single cent.

game-hours: 684.3
review: Oh, where do I even start? This game is one of the best I've ever played, as you can see by my 600+ hours ingame. It's fun, cooperative, and even stupid (in the good way). Right off the bat, this game impressed me. The size of the maps, the amount of things you can put in them, and thats about it. but then, I saw the glorious, amazing Addons tab. This is one of the greatest assets of the game. It allows players to make weapons, vehicles, maps, even NPCs for the game, and there are ALOT of packs out there. You can make a server, with your favorite map, vehicles, and weapons and screw around with you friends on a private server. Now say you don't have any friends with Gmod (the shortened term for Garry's mod). That's ok! you can go on public servers and make friends. Trust me, this is a game worth buying. Unfortunately, there are also downsides to the game. The main one being that most of the servers will have missing textures, resulting in error signs or pink and black skins on different items in the game. The reason for this is that you need Counter Strike: Source for the textures to appear correctly. Thats about it, and I gave the game a 9/10, mainly because of the missing textures. but don't worry, the missing textures aren't gamebreaking.

review: Garry's mod is one of the best sandbox/community driven games on PC and possible in Gaming. game-hours: 318.2
review: I went to visit the Garry's Mod's offices back in October 2013, I wished to look into career opportunities at Facepunch studios and perhaps meet Mr Newman for myself. I was personally greeted by what appeared to be a Gorilla in an adidas tracksuit working the receptionist desk. As I approached the specimen, it reached it's large furry mitt towards me and grasped my hand while grunting - fracturing 2 or 3 bones in grabbers. The monstrous being began to beat it's chest and grunt - which I later interpreted was Primate for "Mr Newman will be down shortly." I sat there in the waiting room and finally met Mr Newman, he had a large gold medallion (that I later learnt was bronze with gold plating) that had the words BAD MUTHAA inscribed. We got into the elevator and made smalltalk. As we were between the 1st and 2nd floor, Mr Newman turned to me and started producing a high pitched screech "EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE". I was threatened to say the least and tried to back away towards the wall of the elevator. He turned to me whilst still screeching "EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE" and began raining blows on my stirnum, it felt like minutes were going by but I was paralysed with fear as he continued to screech and pummel my now bloody and beating torso. "EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE" *THUMP* "EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE" *THUMP* "EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE" *CRACK* "EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE" After Mr Newman had shattered my rib cage I felt my lungs filling with blood and I lost consciousness. I awoke to find myself in the basement of the building ductaped to a filthy, piss and blood stained hospital bed. As my eyes adjusted to the artificial lighting I met eyes with Mr Newman who was wearing nothing but a diaper and a childs size pink t-shirt with the words "Daddy's Princess" wrote in glitter across the front. We continued this Mexican stand off, me bloodied, broken and weeping with Mr Newman appearing visibly aroused. I had a great deal of trouble breaking his piercing gaze but my eyes were drawn to his malformed, pasty, hairless body. If I wasn't in such pain perhaps I'd have imagined a shaven cerebral palsy suffering Orangutan stood staring me down. He produced a large syringe filled with a suspicious fizzing green liquid that he injected directly into my temple. After 30 seconds of unimaginable pain and terror I once more lost consciousness and blacked out. I awoke to find myself unharmed, with not even a single scar nor bruise on a bench facing the Face Punch studios main entrance. Looking down at myself, I doubted my own sanity as I had nary a hair out of place. The only recompence I had was that I had in my hands an authorized application form that they had accepted my application to become a software developer with the company which shockingly to me, was entirely in my hand writing. I have now been working with Facepunch studios for 2 years now and would happily recommend anyone curious to pay us a visit, on Friday's at precisely 1pm Mr Newman will grease himself up in chip batter and gallop around the offices after employees on all fours. Those who he catches he drags to his office in rusted chains, those luckily enough to escape get to go home early.
