game-hours: 299.1
review: I was introduced to Gary's Mod by my older brother. He was playing prophunt at the time. One day, I walked into his room, and asked what he was doing. What it appeared to be, was him controlling a tiny teal-colored coffee cup. I was genuinely confused. But it peaked my interest, and I walked up to him at his computer. "Playing Gmod." he said. "What's g-mod...?" I returned. "A game where you can play a ton of different game types." as he scurried under some boxes, a guy in white shooting at him. "Who's that guy shooting?" "That's a hunter. I'm a prop. It's like hide and seek, but you have to kill the enemy team to win. Or outlast the timer." "... What?" I asked. "Just watch." When I looked back at the screen, he had scuttled around a courner and somehow miraculously became a.. a soda machine? I was about to ask what in the world was going on, when I then heard the famous, "Baby don't hurt me" song start to play... And then a white guy ran right past, and my brother broke out into fits of laughter. "What just happened?" I asked him. "That guy is an idiot, how did he not see me?" "Maybe because you aren't a person in the game?" "Well yeah, but that's the point. As a prop, you can pick to be almost any item you can find on the map by pressing 'e' while looking at it. Props are meant to hide and blend in, and the hunters have to find and kill them." "Oh..?" "Props win by waiting the timer out, or if all the hunters die." "How would the hunters die..?" I asked. "Oh, if they shoot an item that isn't actually a person/prop, it hurts them." he explained. "Oh. What was with the music?" "Just taunting the hunters. Gives them a clue to where I am. You don't get to pick what it plays though. Could be anything, depending on the server." My brother went to 'taunt' again, and this time got stuck with one that doesn't end for the rest of the round. He ended up getting found, and lost, but I drew one conclusion from watching him play: It looked like a ton of fun! I ended up buying Gmod for myself, and found that it is a very entertaining, fun game to play with friends. It's also a game that has a very large variety of people that play it, since it's kind of made for everyone. It's a game you can hop on when you're bored, or want a good laugh. Prophunt is only one game-mode within Gmod, there's a lot more! Including, for example: - Another variation of 'hide & seek' - 'Trouble in Terrorist Town', a game where lying and deceitfulness help you win the game - Sandbox, where you can basically do whatever you want, and create whatever you want (for all you minecraft enthusiasts out there!) - A game similar to 'Slenderman' + so many others, that I can't name them all here- you'll have to check them out for yourselves! Happy gaming. :^) 10/10 would play again

review: There comes a time your life where you have to go " it" and review things. The base game is fine, you got the workshop and you're able to import old mods from previous GMOD versions with the assist of a mod that can extend the explorer in order to that, you can build what you want, make GMOD movies, or go online to play  Roleplaying games, Deathrun and stuff like that. If you have no clue what the  you're doing, you got no clue what the  you're doing and that's that. review: Garry's Mod is a physics sandbox. Unlike regular games there aren't any predefined aims or goals. The game's makers give you the tools and leave you to play! You spawn objects and weld them together to create your own contraptions -- whether that's a car, a rocket, a catapult or something that doesn't have a name yet -- that's up to you. If you're not too great at construction -- don't worry! You can place a variety of characters in silly positions.

game-hours: 72.5
review: Garry's Mod is a sandbox game where you can basically do anything by downloading mods on the Steam Workshop. You can create posters by posing your favourite characters of pretty much any game, and you can also create animations using ragdolls and stop motion. The same can be done in multiplayer, as well as the amazing game modes the community has created. You can't really review a game based heavily on mods and the errors they might cause, but the only problem with this game as a whole is the loading times when playing multiplayer. Sure, it's a nice addition to delete the addons/mods the server installed after you leave, but sometimes a server can have hundreds of them, and you might be on a loading screen for hours. This is especially bad because if you want to regularly play on a server like this and it doesn't happen to have a list of addons, you'll have to memorize and find all of them and download them for yourself.

game-hours: 885.7
review: I see lots and lots of negative reviews on this game talking about the awful community, and how FNAF fans have ruined the workshop with reuploads of player models and disfuncional NPCs and that the vast majority of players are 6-12 year olds with no respect, terrible to non-existent microphones and 0 knowledge of how to play the game. This is 100% true. YouTubers with legions of prepubescents at there command have taken over the community. The problem is, the only knowledge these new players have is a couple of glitched spots on Prop Hunt and no understanding of Sandbox or DarkRP, all they want to do is kill people and buy SeaNanners T-Shirts (75% of players me and my friends come across do not know not to change there skin from the default, which instantly tells us that they are completely uneducated on the correct way to play). That may be a reason not to get this game, HOWEVER it is not about the game. The game itself is a brilliantly presented sandbox with infinte posibilites and seemingly endless amounts of fun. I recommend first of all Learing how to play; Hopefully you have a friend who has good knowledge about the game and can teach you, (When I started, my friend taught me, soon after I was teaching others, I've taught about 4 of my friends the baisics and how to play) You might want to hop on to single player sandbox and test out your skills. The next step is getting friends; For this I recommend getting quite a large posse together maybe around 13-20 players. You can do this buy 1. Already having that many skilled friends who play. Or 2. Playing medium pop. TTT/Sandbox/DarkRP servers; these are all great and fun gamemodes when you play them properly or with friends, the key here is to find friendly people who speak your language and seem to enjoy playing and talking with you, I personally have formed multiple friendships from adding people who were friendly and playing with them every so often. Now you've done that, we can move on to the final part. Finding or Buying a server for your friends; All you need is a server in the region of 5-15/month, you or your friends could buy one, and donate for admin powers so they can pay for it. Or the other option is FINDING A SERVER, this is quite simple with TTT, just find one thats alwas got some people on it and doesn't have an extreme number of addons and playermodels, but for DarkRP and Sandbox its much mor difficult. DarkRP servers are usually Heavily modded which most of the time is a good thing, just go on one of the really high pop. ones, download all there content and stick with it because usually they have lots of players for a reason. Finding a Sandbox server can be extemremly time consuming, many are unstable, have poor to non-admins, and usually will have all the Addons on that you dont like, or have all the ones you do like, and an Admin who always abuses with the Aimbot Gun. Which is why I suggest Buying one, You can have all your friends on, you can kick who you want, you can play with whatever mods/gamemodes and you can build in peace. That in itself is one of the most fun things about this game, Having fun with your friends :3 That is why I reccomend this game.

game-hours: 656.8
review: Okay, so I'm hearing you ask "Why should I buy Garry's Mod?" Well, you'd find that a silly question too if you'd been through the same experience some of us have been. And now, I just want to say, the reason I'm writing this review is because it's one of my favourite games. My favourite, probably. But I also want you to know I could say "I recommend this game, it's awesome" and be done with it. But that's not what makes you want to buy a game. So, first off, a history lesson. Garry's Mod started off as a mod for Half Life 2. You play through standard Half Life 2, whilist spawning in whacky inventions to help you along the way. It's so much more than that now. It still runs off the same Half Life 2 game engine, like CS:S and TF2 do. I guess it would be classified an FPS sandbox game. But you can change that. You can spawn in classic Half Life 2 props, weapons, entities, npcs, spawn in other peoples creations, go into other people's worlds, try out some other classic gamemodes like Jailbreak, Trouble in Terrorist Town or DarkRP. There are also lots of things that aren't from the Half Life 2 game in sandbox. Tools. Weld, duplicate, face posing, weight and so many more. What's that you say? You want more? We can handle that too. This is where the game really shines. Addons. If you go onto the main menu, they'll be a tab called 'Addons'. This is where you can keep all of other players, and you're own creations and mods. Modern Weapons, cars, nuclear missiles! Without addons, you would only have standard sandbox. All gamemodes, such as Melonbomber, TTT, HL2RP, Zombie Survival etc. couldn't exist without addons! Some textures and props you can't get through addons which is understandable for this kind of sandbox game. For CS:S props, you need CS:S. There's DOD, TF2, L4D, HL, DH, etc. Once you have these mounted, (main menu, click the game controller, and tick the boxes in the list) just go into your singleplayer sandbox, and there, in the main props list, will be the ragdolls, props etc. from the games. I reckon this pretty much concludes my very brief review of the game that is Garry's Mod. All the rest... that's for you to find out. Over 'n' out, -Frank

review: What can you do in Garry's Mod? The better question is: What can't you do. This game managed to keep me hooked for hours upon hours of gameplay, despite my terribly short attention span. game-hours: 671.2
review: A very fun game with and without mods, easily one of the better sandbox games out there. There's a huge range of options for different people, from building enthusiasts to machinima makers. The experience gets better when mods are enabled, which adds even more variety. Multiplayer is also great, as you get to interact with fellow players and make friends. The price of the game isn't bad either, costing only $9.99, with prices as low as $2.49 during sales. However, there are some faults in the game, mainly LUA errors, but they're not too major. The selection of maps in the vanilla game is very bland as well. Gripes aside, I highly recommend Garry's Mod, it's worth every single cent.

game-hours: 177.2
review: Well what can I say about this game? It's extremely cheap at just over five pounds and is often reduced down to 2 pounds in steam sales but even the default price is reasonable. Also, is a game that doesn't require a super beefy PC with an expensive graphics card or CPU to run at a decent framerate, I played most of the hours on it on my 5 year old laptop and only recently upgraded to a gaming PC . It enables you to use maps, textures, weapons, characters and pretty much anything from other games compatible with it such as Left 4 Dead 2, Counter Strike:Source and other very popular games such as a Free to Play (F2P) game called Team Fortress 2 (TF2). With this feature built into the game it enables you to explore maps create/ spawn NPC`s (Non playable characters), vehicles and pretty much anything else your head can think of. I have played Gmod for nearly 200 hours and I can definitely say that I would recommend this game to a friend as well as TF2, and as a matter of fact I ended up buying this game, because one of my friends suggested it to me to play.

review: Well what can I say about this game? It's extremely cheap at just over five pounds and is often reduced down to 2 pounds in steam sales but even the default price is reasonable. Also, is a game that doesn't require a super beefy PC with an expensive graphics card or CPU to run at a decent framerate, I played most of the hours on it on my 5 year old laptop and only recently upgraded to a gaming PC . It enables you to use maps, textures, weapons, characters and pretty much anything from other games compatible with it such as Left 4 Dead 2, Counter Strike:Source and other very popular games such as a Free to Play (F2P) game called Team Fortress 2 (TF2). With this feature built into the game it enables you to explore maps create/ spawn NPC`s (Non playable characters), vehicles and pretty much anything else your head can think of. I have played Gmod for nearly 200 hours and I can definitely say that I would recommend this game to a friend as well as TF2, and as a matter of fact I ended up buying this game, because one of my friends suggested it to me to play.

review: Garry's Mod - Everything you need...
game-hours: 1225.7
review: I can say, without a doubt, that Garry's Mod is one of my favorite games of all time. It really truely is, and, IMO, it even trumps TF2. There's just some simple catches: 1) The game requires PATIENCE, a quality the every day person seems to be lacking 2) The game requires FRIENDS, whether they be IRL or internet friends its up to you, or you need to know how to spot good singleplayer things to do 3) The more of OTHER Steam games you have, the better your experience on Garry's Mod. If you have HL2 E1&2, TF2, CS:S ( a big one), CS;GO, Chivalry, etc, you can "mount" these games into garry's mod, and you will have access the the player models, textures, sounds, resources, and a bunch of other stuff ONLY found in those games. 4) The more you put in, the more you get out. If you only half- trying to get things to work and run well, chances are you'll end up not liking this game. It's about taking the initiative and trying out a new part of the game you were hesitant to try before, for example. 5) Wait for Gmod to go on sale. Or better yet, wait until a CS:S/Gmod bundle goes on sale and buy those. Alot of extra in-game Garry's Mod content uses the CS:S textures, and while you can pirate the textures off the internet, it's better just to buy the game. 6) The game get's better if you can manage to get it to work over LAN, which is actually not as compicated as it may seem. 7) Seananners & TTT will quickly consume you. 8) NEVER PLAY A SCARY MAP. THEY  YOUR MIND. That's all about I have to say. Join a server and become a part of it's community, or create your own content and upload it to the steam workshop. There's a ton you can do on Gmod and it has yet to get old for me, and as you can clearly see to the left of my review, I already have 700+ hours on it, and still going strong.

game-hours: 2119.8
review: Edit: So I came back and saw this cringeworthy review, and i decided to change that. Here's a right and propa review. Ok, so, Sandbox game. Seems boring, right? Wrong. Well, Half wrong. You see, this game gains its perks from the content added. It's literally just one big mod for multiple things to be shoved into, made by a man named Garry, hence the name 'Garry's mod'. Some of you may ask; "But Zink, why would i want to buy a game that has no value on its own?" Shut up. This game is honestly one of the best games i've played, and i'd know, i've clocked over two months in-game. With the right games alongside it (Using Valve's source engine) this game can be hella fun. I mean, what other game can you smack a guy with a crowbar, only to find you've been targeted by a custom made suicide drone? None of those Triple AAA games, i'll tell you what. Singleplayer: This section is pretty alright, with lots of custom made maps (qualty varying from map to map) and content to work around with. The main downside to this (and multiplayer) is the content. Without certain games to load textures, you'll get checkers, white marks, or even the infamous 'looping image' where the game drags what you see around the hole to fill it, leaving it a pasted mess of a single texture or object. Multilplayer: It has its perks, though, load times are a thing here. You see, to enjoy the game, you need lots of addons (or only a few and a really REALLY good sense of coding), so, naturally you get a lot of them. When you try to load a server, do you expect it to be fast? Hell no. The fastest load times i have experienced were on the default game, with bare minimum accessed. Granted, I'm running on a laptop, but it took a while for a desktop of mine too. Crashes and coding errors can occur, and those tend to really ruin your day. On the upside, once you get into a server, it's barrels of fun. From chasing down traitors to Role-playing yourself as a mayor, I've seen hundreds of different gamemode ideas sprout from this game, though few can match to the notable ones, such as Trouble in terrorist town, or DarkRp. Either way, It's a fairly fun game to play, and I'm still finding myself moderately entertained after TWO MONTHS of in game time. 8/10.

game-hours: 70.7
review: If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place. Ingredients: 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter 2. 1/2 cup white sugar 3. 1/2 cup brown sugar 4. 1/4 cup water 5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon 6. 1 pinch salt 7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced 8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions: 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). 2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside. 3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices. 4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal. 5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust. 6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

review: Ok...so this is my first complete review of an game. Don't get fooled by my hours in the game, because i want this game from the GMod 10. So, here we go. What is GMod are you asking? GMod is the best Sandbox game. Pretty graphichs, even if there are some textures bugs and errors, even missing textures. A great comunity. What a game would do without the comunity that get's more people into the game? Nothing. Well here is not the case, because GMod got the best comuntiy on Steam, this comunity keeping up the fun rate till' the next update with addons made with hard work. Multiplayer. This game have multiplayer. If you like to construct, fine, enter on one Sandbox server. You want to destroy? Sandbox with friends is the best oportunity to smash things. You don't like to create or destruct? No worries, you can have fun murduring people in ,,The Murder" You don't like that neither? Then go be a traitor in ,,Trouble in Terrorist Town", be The Slender in ,,STOP IT SLENDER" or be Santa in ,,SledgeBuild" or even be in an elevator simulator with ,,Elevator". The posibilities are countles, so the fun. Hope my review helped you to understand what GMod is all about.

game-hours: 658.8
review: Garry's Mod is a sandbox that allows you to play it how you want to play it. By all means, this is no single-player RPG title like Skyrim with an amazing story. This game is about sheer goofiness and fun with friends. Props and characters from most source games at your disposal to create and build virtually anything you want. But for some, this may not be enough. Some may find the "creativity" aspect in this game boring. This is where Garry's Mod shines....Multiplayer. Garry's Mod has one of the best online communities out there on any platform whether it be PC or even consoles. This isn't your average multiplayer team deathmatch, capture the flag game modes that you'd get in other games. There are game modes such as Trouble in Terrorist Town, Prop Hunt, Stop it Slender, and much much more. Trouble in Terrorist town is the most popular game mode on Garry's Mod and the objective is to find the traitors among the innocent players and to eliminate them. The terrorist blend in with the innocent and are virtually imposssible to detect unless they commit a traitorous act before your eyes. The Traitor's objective is to eliminate all innocent. The traitors are always outnumbered, however, they have an exclusive arsenal of weapons and perks at their disposal and most importantly, the element of suprise! This game is always populated and there are a ton of people playing it! And thats just one game!!! There are tons of games that are at your disposal when you play this game! If your on the binge of whether or not you wanna get this, just invest in it because this isn't just a game, it's an experience you won't put down for a long time. The replay value of this game is infinate and deserves to be played by all PC gamers.

Look in the workshop and find just about everything you could ever think of! This is one of my most played games alltime and I don't ever wonder why that is so. review: When I first bought it, it was Garry's Mod 10, so I'm sort of new to it. Although, I know it's a fantastic game. You can make a movie, be a zombie, fight zombies, build a vehicle, build a fort, build a robot, you can basically do anything. It is VERY heavily moddable, there are thousands of workshop items waiting to be used, be a traitor and kill terrorists, be a terrorist and kill traitors, be a detective and help the terrorists kill and find traitors. You can even be a cop, a gangster, a citizen, a hitman, whatever you want. The Source engine is your limit. However, there are lots of people out there who like to ruin the experience, just like every multiplayer game. I hope you found this helpful, and it's completely worth the $10 in my book.

review: Garry's mod is a sandbox game, where you can build whatever you want. For example; you want to make a rocket out of a bathtub? Well go ahead! Garry's mod also has ragdolls, which you can put in poses to make a scene for a wallpaper or such by yourself! The game is completely endless fun, because it doesn't have an actual story. The game is PC-Only, and doesn't need a monster PC to run well, as it is a very old ''game''! Garry's mod is a indie, so it's not too expensive, as it's only 10 normally on Steam! Keep in mind, the Garry's mod needs a source engine game to work, such as; Day of defeat: Source, Counter strike: source or Half Life 2. In overall, Garry's mod is a VERY entertaining experience, even after all these years! Highly recommending the game for everyone with a good imagination, and not necessarily a good PC! The game is so much fun in multiplayer, when messing with friends, making ragdoll scenes or vehicles and such! 10/10

game-hours: 658.8
review: Garry's Mod is a sandbox that allows you to play it how you want to play it. By all means, this is no single-player RPG title like Skyrim with an amazing story. This game is about sheer goofiness and fun with friends. Props and characters from most source games at your disposal to create and build virtually anything you want. But for some, this may not be enough. Some may find the "creativity" aspect in this game boring. This is where Garry's Mod shines....Multiplayer. Garry's Mod has one of the best online communities out there on any platform whether it be PC or even consoles. This isn't your average multiplayer team deathmatch, capture the flag game modes that you'd get in other games. There are game modes such as Trouble in Terrorist Town, Prop Hunt, Stop it Slender, and much much more. Trouble in Terrorist town is the most popular game mode on Garry's Mod and the objective is to find the traitors among the innocent players and to eliminate them. The terrorist blend in with the innocent and are virtually imposssible to detect unless they commit a traitorous act before your eyes. The Traitor's objective is to eliminate all innocent. The traitors are always outnumbered, however, they have an exclusive arsenal of weapons and perks at their disposal and most importantly, the element of suprise! This game is always populated and there are a ton of people playing it! And thats just one game!!! There are tons of games that are at your disposal when you play this game! If your on the binge of whether or not you wanna get this, just invest in it because this isn't just a game, it's an experience you won't put down for a long time. The replay value of this game is infinate and deserves to be played by all PC gamers.

game-hours: 2157.2
review: [Garrys Mod] [Sentinel] [20/06/14] [V13] [Store: 5.99] I bought this game back in 2011, and it changed everything. The overall concept of a sandbox without any predefined goals seemed strange at first but once I got more into the game I figured out that you can do just about anything. The ability to mount other source engine and games and use the models and props from them is a brilliant idea, it enables you to create what you want and make it as ridiculous as you want, and this game has no limits in terms of imagination. [PROS] - Cheap to purchase. - Endless hours of fun. - Huge community workshop and addons. - Works with lua, so creating is pretty much endless. - Multiple gamemodes. - Ability to create what you like. [CONS] - Would require other source engine games to have extra content. - The cheaters are on the rise. - 12 year Olds are on the rise, just being annoying. [OVERALL 10/10]

game-hours: 80.6
review: Ah, Garry's mod. Your life would never be complete if you haven't purchased it. The countless number of features, weapons and game-modes are truly what make this game so unique. This game has to be one of my top 10 games, and I'm sure that anyone who has it as well agrees. My favorite game-mode has to be TTT, in which at the start of each round, approximately one quarter of all players are randomly assigned to be traitors, while the remainder are innocent. Some innocent players are granted access to special equipment in order to discover the traitorous players  these are the detectives. The traitors must work as a team to eliminate all non-traitors before the round ends (usually, there is a round timer), without revealing to innocent players the fact that they are traitorous (for then they would be killed). All in all, I give this game a big 10/10 and reccomend buying it.

game-hours: 394.3
review: Garrys Mod is a very entertaining game. It has everything you could wish for in a game. Deathmatch, building and fun gamemodes. It has many amazing games you can play for example Prop Hunt, Murder, Trouble in Terrorist Town, Melon Bombers, Death match and many many many more. Garrys Mod isn't just one game really you can get Portal 2, Half Life 2 and even Counter Strike: Source and have the features from those games in your game on Garrys Mod you can have maps using textures from all those games! Overall I believe that Garrys Mod is a fantastic game and I will be playing many more hours on this game aswell. I will give the game a 8.5 out of 10 for the quality I will give the game 9 out of 10 for the gameplay because their are many different games you can play within the game itself! If you are looking to see if it is worth buy yes it is 10000000% worth buying and it doesn't even need a really good PC to run as it is very optimized so don't worry about lag! EDIT: I've been playing Garrys Mod for a year now... So far I've put nearly 300 hours into and I still enjoy it! The game modes just keep coming out its just a never ending game. New mods are always being added and that is what makes this the most played game on my Steam account. The game is based off mods. So it will always have new things and won't ever get boring! I want to redo my ratings again now. From now 12/02/2015 I rate this game overall a 9.4 out of 10. The game is amazing but of course a game could never be a 10/10 because nothing could be perfect! If you want to know what gamemodes are enjoyable well a list are: -Prophunt -Murder -Trouble in Terrorist Town (TTT) -Hide and seek -Slender Arrivals -Melon Bomber -Deathmatch -Sledbuild -DarkRP ( Not played it much) -SimRP (Played this for quite some hours, theres also more RP servers) -Pirateship Wars -Cinema (AMAZING IDEA, watching videos with friends is great fun!) -Sandbox (You can build anything from a house to a  rocket!) Theres are over a hudred more game modes and thousands of mods you can check out aswell!

game-hours: 3646.0
review: Garry's Mod is a sandbox game with endless possiblities. In Sandbox mode you can build bath tub cars, design box forts with your friends to survive a zombie attack or create the ultimate walking death tank (why not?). The only limitation is the physics and your imagination. Bored of the default Sandbox mode? Why not find some additional content (addons) on the steam workshop. Bored of workshop? Find another gamemode. Want to build space ships and explore a mini solar with your friends? Play Space Build. Want to survive against hordes of zombies? Play Zombie Survival and survive for a certain amount of time by building barricades to protect yourself. Want to pretend to be a detective and want to find out who is a murderer or innocent civilian? Play TTT (trouble in terrorist town). My evidence for why this is such a good game - Over 3000 hours of playtime. TLDNR: Buy Garry's Mod if you like a game with no restraints or objective other than your imagination. There are addons and gamemodes to play/use when you get bored of the Sandbox mode.

game-hours: 1869.7
review: You can basically do anything you want in this game; NPC Battles, PVP, Roleplay, Videos, Screenshots, Dioramas, Missions, Play Maps, Create Addons, Mess Around With Addons and much more. The only thing a dislike about this game is that even on a beast of a computer, the game can lag like hell, depending on what you do (especially with NPC battles). The thing that I, personally like the most is the fact that you can mess around with the engine and experiment with scripting. My favorite thing to do is have NPC Battles, which is where you have different NPCs (NPC means Not Player Character, meaning that it can be anything that follows AI and is not a player). I also like messing around on maps that people make. In the end, what would I give this on a scale from 1 to 10? Even though glitches can be annoying, as well as lagging and crashing, but I will give this a big fat and juicy 10/10. I also really enjoy sandbox type games, like this where you can do practically anything having to do with scripting. This has been a review by KaijuCake, and thanks for taking your time to read this. I would like to know YOUR opinion! Please do tell me what you think!

review: Totally awesome game. Cheap but very addicting. The negative reviews have a point though because some servers you can never stop playing and others you never want to set foot on again so it really depends on which servers you play. My personal favourite would have to be the role playing because there are some really crappy role playing servers out there where you can troll the hell out of people, and then there are the other ones where you never want to get banned from because there too awesome. All-in-all it's a wonderful game for the price. On a side note before you consider purchasing the game the $9.99 version of the game tends to be pretty glitchy i.e. sometimes everything is purple and black and/or you see through walls. If you don't mind that then go ahead but you might regret it later as my friend said it gives him a headache from looking at it for a prolonged period of time. review: "The exact definition of Jewishness is not universally agreed uponneither by religious scholars (especially across different denominations); nor in the context of politics (as applied to those who wish to make Aliyah); nor even in the conventional, everyday sense where "Jewishness" may be loosely understood by the casual observer as encompassing both religious and secular Jews, or religious Jews alone. This makes it especially difficult to define who is an Ashkenazi Jew. The people have been defined differently from religious, cultural, or ethnic perspectives. Since the overwhelming majority of Ashkenazi Jews no longer live in Eastern Europe, the isolation that once favored a distinct religious tradition and culture has vanished. The center of Judaism today is once again in Israel, although a large community continues to live abroad, particularly in the United States of America, where Ashkenazi Jews live alongside other Jewish groups. Furthermore, the word Ashkenazi is often used in non-traditional ways, especially in Israel. By conservative and orthodox philosophies, a person can be considered a Jew only if his or her mother was Jewish (meaning, more specifically, either matrilineal descent from a female believed to be present at Mt. Sinai when the ten commandments were given, or else descent from a female who was converted to Judaism before the birth of her children), or if he or she has personally converted to Judaism. This means that a person can be Ashkenazi but not considered a Jew by some of those within the Jewish communities, making the term "Ashkenazi" more applicable as a broad ethnicity which evolved from the practice of Judaism in Europe." -Wikipedia, Introduction to Ashkenazi Jews

review: While this is clearly an enjoyable game, evident of my 4000 hours, I won't recommend it for many reasons. If you find something you really like here, it will be very easy to get lost in it and spent countless hours on it, even if you're not doing anything new. That's how garry's mod is. If you don't have enough free time for this game it can be seriously detrimental to your personal and professional life. The community in this game is excellent and terrible. There are some fantastic people on this game, but there are plenty of stupid children and teenagers as well. If you can take the bad people in stride, you will like the community. The variety in this game is incredible, no need to comment on that. If you're willing to explore some gamemodes you will probably find something fun for yourself. However I would not recommend picking this game up unless you know for a fact you won't get addicted to it or you have very good self restraint. Because of the majority of people fall into those categories I'm going to put "Not Recommended".

All-in-all an excellently created time-waster with its fair share of glitches and physics errors.

game-hours: 895.8
review: Garry's Mod, or Gmod, is in my opinion one of the best games out there. You don't need a $2,000 commander of a gaming computer to run it, and you can juice knowledge, laughs, wisdom, patience, and other experiences and acquired skills from only your first few hours of gameplay. With the games dirt cheap price, endless possibilities of gameplay to explore, and the guarantee that you will find at least one domain in the game that suites your likings, why not grab a few quarters from under the couch and scoop this game up. First, the community is often welcoming and usually accepts mature players with open arms. I have experienced first hand that with the endless possibilites of things to do in garrys mod, you will easily be able to find a nitch of contribution to the game. Whether its map building, character models, graphics design, server staff/owner, or a much larger, smaller, or unique job, its out there. Garry's Mods different gamemodes excel, but here are a listed few: -Prop Hunt: Hide & Seek on crack. -Stranded: Survive on a weird island with other outcasts, fighting aliens and gathering resources while developing your new 'home' -DarkRP: Dark Roleplay is life but is actually fun and enjoyable! -ZombieRP: Nom nom nom, human happy meal. -Creative: Let your thoughts, emotions, and bodily fluid-like desires flow out onto a 3-D pallet. Those are 5 of 70+ gamemodes! If you can't find some sort of enjoyable outline in those options, I'll pay for a mentor in how to properly train you to pick games.

review: It's basically the biggest sandbox in your entire life and maybe in the afterlife. So for instance, you don't own TF2, you won't have access to the TF2 models,props, maps, etc. Probably it's only downside, other than the lack of public servers being what you're looking for , so this is basically a game that you must play with your friends in private and just enjoy yourself as public servers all have a specific gamemode already set into them and the ones that don't, don't allow you to do most of the stuff other than watch and "assist" them in building which sucks

review: First off this game is basically anything. There are many gamemodes which make the game many games examples are: Prop hunt Murderer Trouble in Terrorist Town DarkRP Deathrun Those are just a few of many gamemodes but there are addons which make the game what it is addons are user generated content that anyone can download from the steam workshop to use in their garry's mod. Heres a list of the best addons IMO: Parakeets Pillpack TDM Cars Advanced Duplicator 2 SCars M9K Weapons and many more that I can't remember at the moment. Maps are your environment that you get to build in if you're playing sandbox which is the default gamemode of the game many people make maps that are different there are all types of maps maps meant for RPing maps meant straight up for building maps that are meant for driving. Everymap has its purpose. My favorite map is gm_bigcity Overall this game has so much potential because it allows the user to do what they want and it is cheap only 10 dollars! Now that I taught the basics GO AND GET THE GAME! EDIT: Spelling and Grammar 10/10 Would waste time again.

game-hours: 142.7
review: You can't go wrong in Garry's mod. Theres the occational miss fire which causes mass destruction but within the two seconds afterward you realize that it was better that the random contraption you originally concocked from whatever, crazy mindset you had. This game really is limitless, you could give me any, ANY, idea that may not even agree with science itself. You could create in in Gmod as many affectionatly call it. I converted the weight of an Abrams tank to 5 altogether, then roped it to the DeLorean from back to the future and sequentially used it as a mid-evil flail to murder several copies of Dr.Eggman from sonic. If that hasn't convinced you to pay the $10.00 that it is to buy this amazing game, look up Garry's mod videos on youtube, People have created crazy things I didn't even know were possible, the multiplayer is amazing considering if you have other source games you can play other game modes than sandbox. A famous example would be TTT (trouble in terrorist town). Go ahead look it up, See? Theres so much fun to be had withh Gmod, especially with friends. It's been countless times I have been carpet bombed with jets made entirely of NPC's. Doesn't even make sense, You say. In gmod nothing does, I've had dog fights, With real flying dogs. I don't even have very many hours on record and this is already an amazing game. If your not interested in the fighting aspect, You can make youtube videos that can be great. If your alive I recommend getting Garry's mod, There are only a few flaws that can be easily avoided with simple caution. These screenshots show off pretty well the potential that gmod has, there isn't a reason to hesitate getting gmod. What are you waiting for? Go for it!

game-hours: 277.0
review: Garry's Mod is my #1 most played game on Steam for a very good reason. I bought for single-player and stayed for the multi-player. Though sometimes it isn't very beginner friendly, I believe most people will be able to get the hang of basic building concepts quite quickly especially because there is an abundance of great YouTube tutorials. Though, if building and sandbox isn't necessarily your thing. There are many games in the multiplayer section that can satisfy your needs. Some include Trouble in Terrorist Town, Hunger Games, and Prop Hunt. Most of these servers consist of many friendly admins (SOME), though due to the game's recent YouTube popularity with Channels like Seananners showcasing the game, it has seen a spike in some of the, for lack of a better word, more immature players, who's only reason to play is to ruin other player's experiences. Though I think that if you can find a good server and stick to it, you will have a blast in this game, whether it be with friends or alone. Perhaps you'll even meet some new friends in game. I highly recommend this game.

review: Garry's Mod, the hidden gem in the store of steam.Without further a due here is my review. However it is not always great you'll find many errors and glitches throughout the game because of you're imigination, which can be fun but it is not when you're online you will most likely need Team fortress 2 and Counter Strike:Source to fill most errors in. when that is out of the way you can begin to see wondrous creations by the community and 1000's of addons for you're hearts content. Dont let my time confuse you on my account this is my second account and overall on both I have player over 700 hours of this game! That is the charm of garry's mod ; its community is so polite yet creative you can not help to not contribute. Personally Garry's Mod is a must buy on steam, 10/10 will play again.

game-hours: 664.6
review: I would suggest this game to people that are well rooted within the Source engine, who have practically every single game available. I was highly disappointed that this game did not include the basic content to use the various fantastic addons created by the community. If you can, get the CSS+Gmod bundle. It will really make a difference. That said, once you have finally purchased the Valve complete pack [which is 99 bucks - dayum], you'll enjoy a rich sandbox with entrancing and addictive Multiplayer gamemodes, including TTT and Zombie Survival. The addons created by the community are very fun to use, including the TARDIS and the Bendi-Bus vehicles. All in all, I can't decide whether or not to recommend this or not, but for this instance I'll assume that you own everything else.
